Reviews.Title: The Samsung LN40C630 is the best TV under $850
Reviews.Author: RC
Reviews.Content: First of all, I spent almost two months doing research online, reading customers reviews and comparing features on various LCD and Plasma models in the $850 - $900 range. Out of all those HDTVs, the C630 was the one that offered the most features and best performance for the price.The colors and black levels on this TV look amazing right out the box. I always keep my TV on "movie mode" when watching movies and some TV shows because it makes me feel like I am at the movie theater. Also, this TV looks better than most LED-HDTV models from last year when properly calibrated. That 120,000:1 contrast ratio does really make a difference.Standard definition channels at 480p look better than in most HDTVs. 720p/1080i HD channels look unbelievable. It looks like if you were there.I haven't played any Blu-ray discs yet because I don't own a Blu-ray Player but I can assure you that 1080p content would look better than HD channels in 1080i and 720p.This TV also reads portable hard drives and thumb drives in either FAT32 or NTFS formats. I have a 500GB portable hard drive with most of my DVD collection and some 720p Blu-ray rips. I don't even use my media center pc anymore because this TV plays every movie format that I have from .avi, .mkv, .divx, .mp4 and etc..If you don't have a portable hard drive, you can also connect this TV to your home network using an Ethernet cable so that you can play photos, music, videos and movies from your PC.The audio is better than I expected, I keep the volume at 35 or 40 when watching action movies and it does the job. I might get a home theater later on but for now the built-in speakers are fine.Get this TV and you won't regret it!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture quality
Reviews.Author: Skeptical consumer
Reviews.Content: I've had the Samsung LN40c630 for about a month and it has an truly amazing picture quality. It rivals and I feel surpasses image quality of far more expensive products. It is most likely the best product for the money I've ever purchased and this comes from a highly skeptical consumer.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: T. Anderson
Reviews.Content: Had good luck with a previous Samsung LCD TV. Was thinking of going LED this time, but the prices are still a bit high. We found a good deal on this TV, through Amazon, and even thought it didn't have any reviews at the time we purchased it, we took a gamble.Glad we did. The picture is SOO crystal clear...much better than our previous Samsung TV (which is still really good mind you). Sound (without additional external speakers) is pretty decent, too.If you can get this TV for under $800, it's well worth the price. Very good. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Questionable Support
Reviews.Author: Dana L
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV from Amazon, and it arrived two days later. Unfortunately, the TV was defective in that all images had a reddish tint. I have worked in the high-tech industry long enough to know that sometimes things are defective, so I figured that I would give them a chance to repair or replace it. I called Samsung, and they said that they would send out a service person. About a week later, a technician came out to repair my TV. First of all, he showed up about two hours after the end of the 4-hour window they provided, but even worse, he didn't have the parts required to fix my TV. He claimed that he had ordered them overnight two days before. The strange thing was that I had scheduled the appointment over a week later, so I didn't understand why the parts weren't ordered at that time. He basically said that I was out of luck, and that he would have to come back again.I called Amazon, and they cross-shipped a replacement. The replacement arrived in a few days, and seems to work pretty well.I did get a call about two weeks later from Samsung, telling me that they wanted to schedule an appointment to repair my TV. For a brand new TV, this level of service is unacceptable. If the product weren't so good, I would have sent it back.Despite the poor experience up-front, I have been pretty happy with the TV. The picture is great, and the sound is pretty good for built-in speakers. Overall, I'm satisfied for the price, although I hope that I don't have to deal with Samsung service again.

Reviews.Title: Nice unit
Reviews.Author: meinfla
Reviews.Content: After purchasing various items from Amazon and being completely satisfied, I decided to purchase a TV which I consider a major purchase. Delivery went like clockwork, Ceva unpacked, assembled and placed the TV. After they were sure it was working, they removed packing and left.The TV quality is excellent. I have cable, the picture was great, I upgraded to a HD box, the picture is even better. I had some tech questions, called Samsung received quick and courteous answers. This is the best 40 inch LCD TV I have seen.Amazon is a great place to buy.

Reviews.Title: A solid all around great buy!
Reviews.Author: Neuronaut
Reviews.Content: I actually bought this TV and had it at home for about a week and loved it, althoguh I returned it, BUT, not because of any bad issues, just because this I was curious to see how it performed since Consumer Reports gave it a very high rating and also a "best buy". I returned because I wasn't in a rush and decided I wanted a bit larger than 40" and perhaps wait for a sale or price drop.The television has a stunning HD picture although I thought slightly below that of the 650 model. I was surprised it also played divx movies, .avi, mpeg4, and mkv without a hitch(did not try other formats), by just popping in my external drive via the usb port (there are 2 of them). It was easy to navigate through the files and when playing a movie you can fast forward, reverse, pause, etc. It has a good choice of screen sizing/zooming. For a non-led the TV is also rather thin and light, and the stand was very nice quality and easy to install. CR says the viewing angle was somewhat limited but I thought it was pretty darn good as I could watch it from a very shallow angle with reasonable (but not face-on) picture quality. Sound was pretty good for a flat panel TV but of course not home theater quality.My wife and I were not prepared to see the weird "soap opera" effect that I now see many people comment about for LCD TV with 120+ Hz. What I refer to is that the lighting, etc. looks like a tv soap opera, or old "Dr. who", maybe like shot on video but also very "real" looking like you are right on the set and can tell it is a set. Supposedly if you turn off or turn down the antiblurring it will alleviate this effect. Some people like it but I don't. It may also be that the PQ is so good that you can detect the "fakeness" of movie props, makup, etc and some people comment that Hollywood has not caught up to the technology. However we were watching only a 720p version of "AVATAR" and even though it was only 720p on a 40" screen it still looked soap opera-ish and the scratch scars on the military sargeant's head looked totally fake,and when they were inside the helicopter/spacecraft it looked like a scene from "general hospital" or "young and the restless". At least it made us laugh and thus increased entertainment value! However I didn't know then to try to reduce the motion effect which interpolates frames and inserts them between the actual frames. This seems to be a problem with basically any 120/240hz LCD HDTVs, but I was told if you buy one, try to get a TV that permits you to separately adjust the anti-judder and anti-blur so you can reduce "soap opera" without introducing more judder.only other issue was SD channels didn't look so good. It may have been our cable signal but it had a faint "double image" next to the image, but then again it may be because I had some sort of motion/image processing on that actually makes SD look worse so I can't blame it on TV. CR rated SD content for this TV "very good".Overall a great LCD and a great value. I think factoring in price, Picture quality, features, and physical quality about the best 120hz LCD you can find. If you want slightly better PQ plus some internet options and willing to pay about $150 bucks more then look at the LN40c650 model. However with this model it seems you can just network it with your PC via ethernet and stream internet content to the TV anyway.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN40C630
Reviews.Author: James McLaughlin "Sailor65"
Reviews.Content: Samsung has a superb reputation and this Television does not let the rep down. This is so simple to set up a baby could have done it, in fact I have not had a television that was easier.All I had to do was plug in all the cabling and switch on, a picture appeared almost straight away.WELL DONE, SAMSUNG

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: RoyBoy
Reviews.Content: I chose this TV mainly because of my prior positive experience with a Samsung LN52A750, which I purchased 21 months ago from Amazon and am still very happy with. I purchased this LN40C630 for my bedroom and it fits in just right size-wise. After two weeks of use, I have not been disappointed with either the picture or other performance aspects. I set it to Movie Mode and Warm2 Picture Mode, which seem to suit my tastes for natural-looking colors. Unlike my LN52, which is connected to a 5.1 surround audio system in my living room, I am using the on-board speaker system on this LN40 TV. I wasn't sure if I would be happy with the audio quality but it is just fine for my bedroom needs. I even turn up the volume quite a bit when I am using my stationary exercise bike and it works great. My only disappointment audio-wise is the lack of a headphone jack, so I can listen in privacy or not have to turn it up so loud when I exercise. My earlier LN52A750 has this feature but Samsung must have decided to delete this on some newer models. This wasn't a surprise as I researched this before my purchase and still went with Samsung because of my good past experience. The lack of the headphone jack is the only reason I rated this TV 4 stars, as otherwise it is an excellent TV.As far as Amazon's customer service, I couldn't be happier. Both of my Samsung TVs were shipped quickly and arrived in good condition. The smaller LN40C630 was delivered to just inside my front door where I unpacked it and set it up myself, which was no problem at all. Although Samsung's instructions say that it's a two-person job to lift the TV and assemble it to the base, I managed just fine doing it alone. I then moved the TV to my bedroom alone, which was no problem as total weight is about 40 lbs with the base. Any larger TV would probably be too unwieldy to lift and move alone. (I had the white-glove delivery and set-up service with my LN52, thank goodness, as I live alone.)

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: Michele "Racer X"
Reviews.Content: OK, so I just wasted 15 min writing a review for this TV that just disappeared. I'm gonna try it again and hope for the best, there might be two reviews from me that show up at some point. I am just so happy with this TV that I am going to give it another try.  I spent a lot of time researching different brands that sold 40" LCD TV's.  I would say the main reason I went with a Samsung is because I have another flat screen Samsung that is still kickin at almost 4 years old. That may not sound like a long time but I bought a Vizio at Best Buy that lasted 13 months, it died one month after the warrenty expired, go figure. My old Samsung is 720p so I wanted to buy a 1080p, 120hz model to see what I was missing.  First let me say that I have purchased many small item from Amazon in the past. This TV (at 749.00) was a big pruchase for me, especially off the internet. Thanks to other reviews from this page I went for it and would do it again. The carrier was a company called Pilot. I was able to select a date and time for delivery. They were there on time, brought the box into my living room, took the TV out, and plugged it in to make sure it worked before they left!  I sat there for a long time reading the instructions and playing with all the settings. After that I watched HD TV, Blu Ray's, PS3 games, football games, even very old movies to see the difference with everything (Blu Ray is out of control)! The 120hz setting is amazing, it makes any Tv show or movie your watching look like a home movie. I can see how this would be distracting but for now I find it facinating. On most things it is overkill, it takes that "movie" feel out. Of course you can put the setting very low without turning it off, which I like.  This is a great TV for a GREAT price. I would buy another big item from Amazon since everything went so well.**UPDATE**  I have had this TV for almost a year now and I am still completely satisfied. I am thinking about getting another to replace a 5 year old TV. You can not beat the price for what you get. I am not interested in widgets and all the other fancy stuff, I use my TV as a monitor for my Mac Mini anyway. GREAT PURCHASE!!

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it
Reviews.Author: Isaac Smith
Reviews.Content: Okay. There are a ton of tv's around this price range. I chose the Samsung because of the image processor. The comparable tv to this is the Sony - KDL40V5100. It uses the Bravia engine 2 which is now old considering the new BE3. Samsung and Sony are very big competitors and are always trying to top each others engines. This is the newest Samsung engine and much better than the BE2 engine. I not only did a lot of research on this tv but actually spent time watching the ones I was looking to buy. The picture quality of the Samsung is extremely hard to beat at this price range and the Sony didn't even come close. The Samsung also have a better upconvert than the Sony. You can read about hz and contrast ratio all day but it comes down to what you like and what you're willing to spend. For me, this was the nicest looking tv at the best price. Make sure to view the HDTV's in standard mode, not dynamic. The box stores are always putting the tv's on the highest settings to attract your attention. This is an amazing tv for the price. I bought mine at Best buy for the same price that is on Amazon. Don't be afraid to ask places to price match. Plus I got the Black tie warranty. I love amazon but money speaks.

Reviews.Title: I give up
Reviews.Author: Quahog
Reviews.Content: In the past two weeks I went through 3 of these TVs. The issue for me was consistent on all three -- the right side of the panel appears washed out, as if it were being overly lit. For example, when watching a baseball game the outfield grass looks beautiful all the way across the screen until you get to the rightmost five or six inches where the color is noticeably lighter. I had guests this weekend and I challenged them to figure out why I was going to return it. All three quickly identified the same problem with the picture. I tried the TV in different locations, daylight and darkness -- the problem is very consistent. It is a shame, because the rest of the picture looks great and it would be a terrific value. Judging by the popularity of this set, I guess most people are not bothered by this problem, but I found it incredibly distracting.

Reviews.Title: Samsung is the best!
Reviews.Author: N. Kennedy
Reviews.Content: I got this TV to replace my Toshiba Regza.  I am glad I did.  This TV is used mostly for movies and PS3.  Movies definitely are better, but the PS3..WOW what a difference!  I really didn't expect the samsung to be this much better.  The gaming on this TV is awesome!The only thing that I didn't care for was the audio on this TV.  I wasn't expecting much considering it was so thin, but it didn't meet my expectations.  I am not saying it is bad, but it is not exceptable to me.  If you are using surround sound, which most people do, this will not be an issue.

Reviews.Title: Best Quality for the Money
Reviews.Author: R. Laurie
Reviews.Content: Pros:  -Incredible Picture Quality  -Great, clean, logical UI  -Great-looking TV  -Swivel Stand  -Good RemoteCons:  -Speakers leave something to be desired: decent high ranges, but a little tinny; almost no low  ranges, which is typical for built-in speakers.  -For some reason, the optical-out jack will only output 2.1 channels from a 5.1-channel HDMI source, but will output up to 7.1-channels from a TV broadcast.  Easily remedied by plugging the blu-ray player directly into the surround system.---After shopping around for an LCD TV for a long time, I knew I wanted a Samsung.  In brick and mortar stores, the Samsung TVs always stand out: they always have the most vibrant, crisp colors, and smoothest, sharpest picture.I was conflicted about getting the 46" 5-series or the 40" 6-series (at very similar prices), but when I saw a 5-series and 6-series next to one another, there was no contest - the 6-series has noticeably better color and contrast, absolutely worth the extra money in an investment like this.Surprisingly Amazon's price was way better (by $50-$100) than any brick-and-mortar store, and free 2-day scheduled delivery with Amazon Prime.  The deliverer even helped my wife take the TV out of the box and set it up.

Reviews.Title: Reliable Strong Performer
Reviews.Author: Avi
Reviews.Content: Not too much to say here. Samsung seems to be a pretty reliable brand, and this TV is no exception. Everything worked out of the box (the TV required some minimal assembly, connecting the display to the stand, but that can be done by a single person). Video quality is very good (as expected), although some people might not like the 120Hz effect (makes non-sports TV shows look 'artificial', for lack of a better term - it's hard to describe without seeing it), or the dynamic backlight (the TV will lower the back-light intensity for 'dark' images to achieve deeper blacks). It's ok though, since both settings can easily be enabled/disabled in the TV's menu.I use the TV for all my video inputs (currently that's just cable, laptop, and Wii), and hooked up a fairly inexpensive external 5.1 receiver powering my surround sound speakers via the digital audio out on the TV. This seemed much easier to me than getting a more expensive receiver with a huge number and variety of inputs (the TV already has plenty for me) and then plugging everything into the receiver, and going from there to the TV. My way, any input on the TV that's currently displayed has it's sound go from the TV to the receiver, and through that, to the speakers. There's no delay between the audio and video that I'm able to discern.Lastly, Amazon's ability to schedule a delivery within a 2-hour window was great - I think most companies give you a much less accurate 8-hour window, which forces you to be home for longer. Overall, very happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: 1 initial concern, though!
Reviews.Author: Seban Jose
Reviews.Content: This is my first HDTV and I totally love it. Not that I have a trizillion others to compare to and be a professional rater but I haven't come across any bad points on this TV as yet. Works just good with awesome picture quality so far. Touch Wood! (I got my renters insurance kicked in as well).The TV came in in due time as promised by amazon and in perfect condition. The delivery guys were even able to install and test the TV for me before they left. Was perfect (I think that is an amazon prime facility though).Having said that, I must say that the first couple days I owned this I was in a slump. The picture clarity was so insanely real that it felt like I was a part of the movie or the scene. For example when Arnold Schwaz. flipped around with his shot gun in terminator I had to dart behind my IKEA sofa for safety. I might not have conveyed the right message in the above 2 lines but the clarity had a sense of unwanted realisticity to it. The scenes and people in the scenes looked like out of a documentary and did not have the "flare", if I might say so, of a movie - "The movie effect" you would get in a theater. Howvere, on a quick online search and enquiries at Best Buy and Walmart I learnt that I was not the first to experience this. I got into a painstaking effort of rectifying this and had to dig into the myriad of options the TV had (as recommended step by step in a webpage) before things began to look better. Not sure what I did in the end of the day but the picture clarity is just fine now and my wife and I have no complaints any more. Terminator and recently Avatar on Blu-Ray as well was insanity unleashed.Gud Luck choosing. I would recommend Samsung and the LN40C630 for sure.Update - 10/19/2011: In further exploring into the TV functionalities, one disappointment I have come across is the fact that the TV is not compatible with Samsung Apps. Therefore, you cannot browse the net on the TV and primarily cannot watch Youtube or Amazon Prime videos over the wireless (which is what is killing me). I have to use a PC-TV connection cable to display PC contents onto TV. It took me hours of exploring to figure out how to share my laptop local hard-disk content with the TV over a wireless network. This is pretty cool, though the internet apps would have been cooler and is what I really need. Note that, amongst others, the LNC650 has the Apps feature.

Reviews.Title: High Quality TV
Reviews.Author: Jason Visser
Reviews.Content: Fantastic TV for the price.  I use my laptop with an HDMI connection to run the TV.  Everything looks great and works well.  The sound quality is definitely above-par for a TV, but ofcourse can't really compare to proper sound system.  Lots of options and settings to tweak in the menus, which can be a little overwhelming, but I really appreciate them.  Has a network connection (wired, or optional wireless), but it is only for media sharing capabilities, this TV does not support streaming Netflix.  This was a bit of a disappointment for me, because I read a review where they said it does support Netflix.  Oh well, aside from that, I highly recommend this TV to anyone who values high picture quality, very little artifacting (stuttering, shuddering, etc).  The bezel attracts a lot of dust, but we have 2 cats, so we probably have more hair/dust flying around than most people.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds expectations
Reviews.Author: K. Picone "Go Pen's"
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this TV thus far.  We replaced a 42 inch Vizio which failed after almost exactly 2 years.  Needless to say, I was simmering mad.  $1400. down the toilet.  But I digress.  Anyway, after lots of research this Samsung just beat the pack in specs and consumer reviews (the only ones that matter).  The price was almost half what I paid for the Vizio and with a 120Hz refresh rate it is a very good bargain.  The only slightly negative comment I have is that the onboard sound is not as good as the Vizio.  Having learned my lesson the hard way, I purchased the 4-year Square Trade Warranty offered by Amazon.  It was only 80 something dollars and I easily justified it to myself since the cost of the TV at Amazon was $50 dollars cheaper than anywhere else I could find it!  I highly recommend this additional purchase.  It's cheap insurance..just in case this TV does not age well.  Finally, I have to comment about the shipping.  I opted for normal delivery and though it took a couple of weeks for me to get the unit (I think it was back-ordered) the company in my area that delivered it was outstanding.  Anyware Express gave me "white glove" delivery which included setup and removal of the dead Vizio at no charge.  Good experience all the way around.

Reviews.Title: Very good Picture and a very good Value for a basic tv
Reviews.Author: tech boo
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN40C630 Review after 4 months.I bought this tv in September 2010 to replace an old 27" CRT style tv.  This thing blows the old style tv's away!  So maybe the big leap weighs my review higher than if I went from a 5 year old LCD to this LCD.The picture is perfectly clear, I only get OTA (over the air) signals.  No overpriced cable for me.  I live in Dallas, so there are over 30 channels, half of them hispanic, religious or product sales, so I get to watch around 15 channels that have regular shows.  The HD channels are awesome on this tv.The screen is very bright and clear.  I was considering the Sony Bravia EX500 - 700 series.  The 500 is in the same price range as the LN630.  The Samsung has better colors to me.  More vibrant with deeper contrast.  The Sony's have muted colors that some say are more realistic.  I like the more vibrant colors so the Samsung won me over even though the Sony has more features; like the internet apps.  This screen is also a matte screen which is what I was looking for.  It is in our living room with 4 very big south facing windows, so glare is a big problem and this really helps.  Don't let the sale people tell you matte doesn't matter and that glossy gives you a better picture.  Under ideal conditions, in a windowless jail cell, they are correct.  The glossy screens do give you a more vibrant and brighter picture, but in the real world of rooms with windows the matte definitely reduces the glare by 50%.  If you can't see the picture the quality doesn't really matter.I'm glad I didn't cave in to the internet features of other higher priced tv's, because they are very limited except for the very new Sony TV with Google TV.  Of course you have to pay a bit more.  There are other ways to get internet on this tv via, blu-ray, laptop, internet boxes, etc. for around $300 or less.The sound is adequate.  I have SD speakers set up, so I have the option to get very good sound at anytime.  I only use my theater system for movies and live sports.  Regular shows and news, these speakers are just fine.Plenty of connectivity; HDMI, composite, USB, ethernet.  If you really need more, then you need to get an AV receiver.  You'd fit the profile of a person needing an AV receiver.Basic setup is pretty straight forward.  Other people have posted their setup specs, which are a good starting point.  One thing I will mention is that I got this tv for the 120hz refresh rate so motion blur would be less noticeable, especially for football.  The best setting is - Auto Motion Plus 120HZ: CLEAR.  Otherwise you get the 'soap opera' effect, which is really weird that Samsung thinks anyone would want that look???  I see no motion blur watching football like the older LCD tv's.  So this is a winner in this category.Ethernet setup was a little more difficult.  I have my PC and router hardwired with CAT6 cable to the tv, getting the tv to see the router took some trial and error.  The auto detect did not work the first time, so I got all the router info and manually set it up... and got a connection error.  Finally I tried the auto set up again and it connected this time.  Why it didn't see the router the first time is beyond me.  But I now can use this tv to show all my photos and home movies to friends and family.  Goodbye projector slide shows, and crowding around a 20" PC monitor !  You can also watch movies from the PC, but I don't do that because of the time it takes to format the movies and the space they take up on my hard drive.This is a more basic model, and the price reflects that, especially a very good sale price.  More expensive tv's have more features, but for the picture quality, this can't be beat.  Also the more basic the tv, the more future proof it is, since the next gadget won't make what few gadgets this tv has obsolete so quickly.  Google tv has already made the previous Sony app and Samsung app tv's dinosaurs.  And 3D tv?  they just came out and now I hear they are already working on 3D tv's without the need for glasses.The only real Con I have is that the IR sensor is to the extreme lower right corner of the tv.  I think most people are like me in that we point the remote to the center of the tv.  Often it doesn't pick up the IR signal if quickly pointed randomly to the center.Finally I checked into the Samsung capacitor problems the '06-'08 tv's were having.  Samsung told me that they had corrected that failure in the '09 models so the 2010 models are clear of that problem.  Incase you didn't know about the capacitor issue, what Samsung did was under engineer their capacitors to the point where after a year or so of use they would burn out and you'd end up with a nice black rectangular mirror.  Often after the one year warranty, so the buyer was SOL.  It's an easy fix for an electrician, but who buys a $1000 tv to last one year?  And how many of us are electricians?  You might want to do some research to clear your mind of this Samsung problem, because it spanned all their tv lines.This tv rocks for sports, everyday use and especially because you get more bang for the buck !****update June4, 2011****I have started to move all my movies from DVD to mp4 on an external hard drive (see my iomega ego 2tb review).  Man it's nice to get rid of the DVD's.  Mp4's are 1-2gb in size and the picture quality is about the same.  I cannot notice a difference.  I just plug in the iomega hdd via usb and use the samsung tv remote to find my movie and watch!  could not be easier.  Sound is also theater surround just like the DVD.  I plan on getting another HDD and getting rid of our 8yr old 5 DVD disc changer.DNLA also works like a charm.  I use the Samsung PC Share Manager program and can easily watch photos or movies from my computer.  Although there are some flaws with the samsung pc share manager.  The most glaring is that photos are displayed in a random order, not in the order as you see on your hard drive, WTH?!?!?!  So vacation slide are shown skipping all over the vacation time period?!?!  that make no sense.  It seems as if the program is a high school student's science project.To get around the randomness of the photo order, I have to use the plain DNLA connction, but that sometimes distorts the photos when they go from landscape to portrait.  the following photo is stretched to landscape when it should be portrait.  So there is no one fits all solution, I just wish Samsung would update the program and fix that one bug.

Reviews.Title: JULY 2013 UPDATE
Reviews.Author: Pelvin Gamble "Nature Boy"
Reviews.Content: I have no regrets about this purchase. First off I was a little hesitant purchasing a big ticket item from amazon.com but since I have had nothing but great experiences with amazon I took the chance. Delivery was quicker than I expected and the driver set up the TV (I requested the set up to check for damage and to make sure it was not DOA). Five stars as usual for Amazon.Now for the TV...I have waited 6 months to review this TV because I wanted to make sure that I was satisfied. No regrets! I was debating between the similar Sony (40ex500) and this Samsung LN40c630. I am a Sony man and to be honest the Samsung won because of the amazon price at the time and the offer for 24 months no interest financing.I could not be happier with my decision. The TV is beautiful. The Picture is excellent in HD and Bluray and standard definition is OK but I don't attribute that to the TV. The Menu is easy to understand and settings are plentiful. 40 inches is perfect for my sitting distance (about 8 feet). I know a few people complain about the sound but for me it is fine, I do have a stereo receiver that I have the TV connected to but I only use it for listening to music channels, for regular viewing the TV speakers are perfect for me. I have had the TV for 6 months now and I have not had one problem with and don't expect to have any at all because everything seems solid and reliable. If by some chance there comes a problem I will let you know.To those doing research on LCDs...I researched and debated for a year before making this purchase and as stated before I have no regrets. Thanks for reading I hope this helps.UPDATE...JULY 2013I wanted to take the time to amend my review to let others know about the panel problem on my TV and my displeasure with its short life. I have been very happy with my Samsung LN40C630 until 2 weeks ago. The panel started going out (panel version code - AAO1). It randomly gets dark and sometimes it seems to have a ghostly white film over the screen and other times the colors bleed all over the screen. Upon further inspection I discovered that it also had what some call jailbars running up and down the screen. I was very surprised because I have always considered Samsung a reliable company. I expect a TV to last longer than 3 years no matter what kind it is (LCD, LED, Plasma). I have a Sony (Tube version) from 10 years ago and it still plays perfectly. The LCDs may not last as long as that but 3 years...give me a break.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV
Reviews.Author: Jenny Cook
Reviews.Content: I got this one recently. It is very stylish and elegant. You can expect nothing more from the picture. It is simply brilliant.I know people spend days researching TVs - dont waste your time  just get this one and you will be fully satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 40 inch
Reviews.Author: kfab12
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV since mid July of 2010.  I waited to post a review to see if there was going to be any issues with it.  So far I can say that not a thing has gone wrong.  The picture quality is great.  The sound is fine for me.  I really like the set up features and found that some of the reviews and what others recommended was very helpful instead of going at it on my own and trying to figure it out.  If you plan on getting this TV, do some digging in these reviews because they are really helpful.  I have no regrets buying this TV from Amazon and having it delivered.  It was delivered prompt and handled with care.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier
Reviews.Author: Charlie S
Reviews.Content: After putting off buying an HDTV I finally broke down. I had a perfectly good 27" Sony Trinitron that I was happy with. I did alot of research with Consumers Reports and on the web and decided on Samsung 40". I loved the swivel base. Not all HDTV's come with a swivel base. It was a little bit more but the reports were very good. I was always taught you get what you pay for. Went to a few stores and priced a few sets. Amazon had the best price but I was concerned about having a TV shipped. I never bought anything from Amazon before. I was so impressed when I read that when ordered what time period and day I wanted it delivered. I ordered on a Sunday and chose to be delivered on Thurday between 10-1pm. I was able to track the package. Then I got a call at 10:15 on Thursday and the driver said he was in the neighborhood and will be there shortly. I walked out on my terrace to have a smoke and they drove up in 3 minutes. I checked the package and model number and told them I was impressed with the service. I hooked it up shortly thereafter and was very pleased. I would reccomend the TV but I should have gone a little bigger but I had a budget. I was impressed with Amazon service.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN40C630 40-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LCD HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: R. Riley
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice television.  The picture quality is great!  You can adjust the size of the picture on the screen, as well as adjusting for movie settings, natural, etc.  It has a lot of features that I haven't even used yet.  My only advice would be if deciding between the 40" and 46" go for the 46", I wish I had.  In a smaller room 40" is ok, but in most living rooms at least 46" would be much better.

Reviews.Title: Superb value, image clarity, colors, and sound! Works great in bright rooms! No glare!
Reviews.Author: Tilley Duthie "tilleyd"
Reviews.Content: We have always purchased Sony TVs as part of an ongoing tradition but that has now ended with the purchase of this TV. Our hearts have been won over! The stunning image and text quality this TV provides is truly remarkable, especially when paired with an HD receiver connected with an HDMI cable.Prior to this purchase, we were uncertain whether this TV would present glare issues as we read in reviews that Samsungs are notorious for their glossy reflective screens. Since our purchase, we have not experienced any sort of issues with glare. In fact, in our brightly lit daylight living room the image on the screen remains vibrant, clear and glare free.The built-in TV speakers provide excellent sound and do not require additional investment in a high-end audio system.The thing that attracted us most to this TV was its value! We paid $665 for this TV after some internet rebates. This by itself distinguishes Samsung from Sony and other manufacturers.Setup and installation were a breeze and the operating manual was clear and well-written. We encountered no issues navigating the TV settings and the on-screen menus are intuitive and useful. The overall build quality appears to be sturdy and the product seems to be constructed with quality materials.Move over Japan, Korea is now the king of the hill. Thank you, Samsung!

Reviews.Title: A great TV with awesome features
Reviews.Author: AussieinNY
Reviews.Content: Had this for about 6 weeks now and have only got great things to say about.  Picture quality is first rate with the 120hz refresh really making images vivid. With my 1080 upscaling DVD player you feel like you can reach through the screen to the people and objects. Just got the BD-C5500 blu-rayer player on special from Amazon to match and it is a great combo.  This TV blows away the 2007 Panasonic 42' Professional Series TH-42PHD8UK in our living room.The only minor issues I have found are:- Ability to resize pictures, particularly from video files, is very limited compared with the TH-42PHD8UK.- The built in ability to decode video file formats is great but limited (no .mov, some AVI codecs unsupported). It sometimes crashes and changes device.Cheers

Reviews.Title: Great TV, when signal is HD!
Reviews.Author: Petru L. Cretu
Reviews.Content: I purchased this LCD due to the fact that it had great reviews. It is really a great LCD, with good picture and sound, BUT it performs the best when it has HD (High Definition) programming. Otherwise, the picture is kind of bad and it has a greenish tint all over. Get this LCD only if you have HD programming, otherwise you will be kind of disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Performance
Reviews.Author: Adriana V.
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV now for about 8 months.  I researched TVs for quite some time before settling on . . . . a Panasonic Plasma.  Then I went to Best Buy and looked at televisions for a half an hour.  Then I went to Walmart.  Then I went to Target.  After all that time just staring at screens (and killing more than a few brain cells in the process), I landed on this baby.  Amazon had a deal I just couldn't pass up so I jumped into the brave new world of Hi Def.  After 8 months of football games in HD, video games, and lots of Netflix, I can honestly say this is one of the best purchases I have ever made.  Everyone in the TV realm talks about "blacks" and I find the "blacks" to be very "black" in this television.  Overall, the colors are great - very saturated.  The picture quality is crystal clear.  Seriously, I feel like I'm at the game.  Or killing zombies.  You know, depends on the day.The biggie in this TV is the 120hz.  Now, for the price difference of something like 60 bucks, they upgraded the model from 60 hz to 120 hz and it shows.  It doesn't show all the time, but when it does, it shows.  Panning through a Bluray feels much smoother.  Overall, the entire movie-watching, team-rooting, castle-storming experience is fantastic with this TV.  And as a bonus - I moved in the last 8 months and the TV made it through the move just fine, wrapped in a blanket.  I would recommend this television, or any Samsung, to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Completely Happy with My Purchase!
Reviews.Author: sjhug
Reviews.Content: I was already happy about this TV when it was delivered less than 24 hours after I ordered it, even though I chose my Prime free 2-day delivery.I got it out of the box and set it up myself, and I'm a female college student.  So, it's definitely nothing someone with a tad bit of muscle can't manage to do yourself.  However, I would still consider it heavy so don't try to do it yourself if you think you're gonna drop it.Adding the base was simple and hooking it up to my AT&T; uverse and surround speakers took me all of about 20 minutes and that's with having to run cords through the back of my TV stand, etc.As for the actual quality of the picture and sound.  I am extremely happy with picture quality; I adjusted the different settings to get the right fit for the room/lighting, but now it's perfect.  Every one is going to want to adjust their picture to their own liking--it really does depend on how your room is lit, where you sit in relation to the screen, and just your personal preference.  Sound quality is pretty good for an internal speaker--I would rate it better than most TVs in the same range of quality/price.  However, I already had external speakers with my last TV so I hooked them up.  I did use the internal speakers when playing music from a USB and I was happy with what I heard.Overall, this TV is a huge deal for what I paid ($568.00).  Free Shipping is a plus.  If you are looking for great prices on TVs, the best time to look is during March Madness when suppliers are trying to get rid of old models to make room for new ones.

Reviews.Title: Stunning Picture
Reviews.Author: DeaninVA
Reviews.Content: I bought this 40 inch, which would fit inside my existing furniture, and it is beautiful. In regular broadcasts (haven't upgraded to HD yet) the picture is excellent. Viewing a Blueray disk, it is incredible. Great, great tv. I gave sound a 4 but I don't expect fantastic sound from a flat screen tv.

Reviews.Title: Not recommended
Reviews.Author: fishermanjeff
Reviews.Content: Our first puchase in the flat screen world in the beginning of January.  Amazing picture on this set and thought we were in business.  we only have analog cable but we get a high def equivalent of each of our channels.  Here it is about March 1 and the digital tuner on this set is shot.  Warranty periods are over and nobody will do a thing without shipping it in the original package anyway.  Sounds like this is a common problem with the Samsungs.

Reviews.Title: 400 lb Panasonic HDTV Replaced by light Samsung LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Harvey Muller
Reviews.Content: We had a LARGE bulky HDTV in the living room for a couple years now.  I had been watching LCD tv pricing for awhile and finally made the buy decision for this Christmas holiday.  Despite the Samsung's larger screen, the room feels larger again with the huge cathode ray HDTV absent.These are my subjective observations about the Samsung LCD TV:Physical Appearance.  It is just as handsome in the home as it is in the store.Ease of Setup.  The TV is basically plug and play.  For those not satisfied with the generic setup, the settings menu provides a large number of items to tweak.HD picture quality.  The clarity is amazing.  Only two things to mention.  One, you will probably want to calibrate the display to your own preferences (Google helps).  Two, you will also probably want to pair it with a PS3 or other suitable means of providing an HD signal to the TV to enjoy the full capabilities of the screen.Sound quality.  The sound is great for a TV, but for those expecting a cinema experience you may want to add an external sound system.Remote ease of use.  The remote gets the job done and is easy to use.  The TV takes a few seconds to boot up and turn on, you only need to press the power button once.  =)I preferred the SAMSUNG 40" LED LCD TV because it seemed very crisp and sharp in the store while their LCD TV did not seem as bright.  But I am now content with the LCD TV after having it in the home and putting it through its different modes of operation.HD movies are amazing to watch on this TV.  It feels like we have a little theater in the home.  And now that we have a PS3, my wife cannot get enough of streaming Netflix.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and tons of features!
Reviews.Author: J. Polzin
Reviews.Content: I've been watching the prices and researching HDTVs for a couple of years, waiting for prices to come down on the higher quality units.  When Amazon had this TV for $650.00 with free delivery, I finally jumped.  I have had my eye on Samsung TVs for quite awhile.  Most reviews I've read have been positive for the Samsung brand, and so far I've been very satisfied.PROs:-Great crisp video quality!!  Graphics pop and even smaller text is easy to read.-VGA input is an awesome feature.  I like to play computer games from time to time and also do some video editing on occasion.  Hooking my computer up to the monitor was simple and increases my workspace.  And playing games on the larger screen was amazing.-The USB ports are a nice touch. I only wish that the TV would have audio outputs, so that any music or video accessed through USB could be directed through my surround sound.  But it is nice way to listen to all your mp3s.  It's almost like a giant mp3 player!-Easy to assemble and set up.  Back in the day of massive CRTs and even more cumbersome giant projection units a 40" Television would have required a couple of big guys to muscle it into position.  I was able to unpack, assemble the stand and lift it up onto my television stand entirely on my own, without incident.  It was harder getting rid of the 32'' CRT that was there before.CONs-While this TV allows you to adjust display settings to the most minute detail, it was a bit daunting getting through all the settings.  I found some of the online user comments extremely helpful in getting the display to look great.  It does take some tweaking.  I originally had some judder issues and frame jumping.  (Turns out it was the 120 Hz True Motion settings...they needed to be turned into "off or clear" mode to get rid of the judder)-120 Hz True Motion....I could be wrong here, but at this time I think that it may almost be unnecessary. Almost every source I've connected to the TV only inputs at 60 Hz.  Which is why having true motion turned on caused issues with judder. Perhaps some gaming consoles output at 120 hz???  I'm not sure.  Again, I could be wrong about that.  I had the impression that using 120 hz would improve the clarity and sharpness of images in motion.  With my current settings at "clear" it appears to be un-utilized.  Longterm, however, I could see sources catching up to the 120 hz output, so I won't need to get a new set when that happens.  So perhaps it's an investment in the future.Overall, I'm extremely happy with this TV.  The Pros far outweigh the cons.  Quality for less money...I couldn't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Just WOW! 120hz works!
Reviews.Author: NoTexasCowboy "NoTexasCowboy"
Reviews.Content: I received this TV yesterday to replace my Samsung 720 60hz unit that is moving upstairs to the bedroom and all I can say is WOW!!!Even though my cable box only has a 720 output, the picture on this TV is NOTICEABLY more clear and crisp than the 720 60hz!  So for those of you wondering if the 120hz is worth the upcharge, I thought I would let you know that *I* certainly feel like it is!The built in USB port shows my home videos off of a thumb drive and is as crisp and nice as it is on my monitor, although it only supports a few video codecs. (showed AVI and mpg, but not MOV or mt2s) I have not tried DVD's or Blu-rays yet, as the player will be delivered Tuesday, but I am looking forward to it.  Everything else works beautifully, and looks absolutely great!Setup was as easy as it gets...assemble the stand, attach the TV, put it in place and plug in the HDMI and power cable.  That's it.Recommended :)Best Regards,

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture quality
Reviews.Author: Aiylan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV after hearing rave reviews from my friends who also own a Samsung TV and after determining what size and type of TV that I wanted.  I've watched horror, action and drama movies on the TV.  It all looks great and even the older movies look fantastic.  I definitely recommend this TV!

Reviews.Title: sensational picture
Reviews.Author: Richard Libowitz "critic at large"
Reviews.Content: We have only had our set for a few weeks but are absolutely staggered by the quality of the picture. Film looks like videotape and the clarity gives a suggestion of 3-D.We could not be more pleased.

Reviews.Title: A great deal on a great tv
Reviews.Author: Matthew Alvarado
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture definition especially with blue ray.The black levels are also deep and dark.Great color saturation in all colors. None of that faded LCD look.The picture is crisp and clear from a wide range of angles.Excellent refresh rate with TV or gaming consoles. No ghost images.Excellent sound quality and volume levels even without surround sound.Easy hook-up and intuitive controls.A huge amount of options for inputs and outputs.Overall just a really great TV at a really great price.

Reviews.Title: spike tucson az. great buy great tv
Reviews.Author: spike
Reviews.Content: dollar for dollar great tv terrific picture just be careful of price amazon is great buys but they change prices by the week bought this tv for 710 2 weeks aago want to buy my daughter one today its saying 749 don't understand ?

Reviews.Title: Captain Kirk is in my living room!
Reviews.Author: SMG "homebodies"
Reviews.Content: This television has a beautiful picture, good sound, and is a pretty set.  My husband keeps shouting at the tv for those people to "get out of our living room!"  Great price for the quality.

Reviews.Title: Good value for the money
Reviews.Author: Paul Lockyer "Headhunter"
Reviews.Content: This is my third flat panel.  The other two were Panasonic Plasmas. One I hung from a bedroom wall and it weighs over 80 pounds so I'm not exactly a novice.  I thought the Samsung had really lousy instructions.  It was unclear how to attach the stand and took a few tries to figure out.  The manual switches on the panel are not easy to find or use and the instructions tell you little about locating them.  I thought the TV had no manual on/off switch until my wife inadvertently bumped it and turned on the TV.  It turned out to be a touch/screen (like a PDA) with manual controls in the lower right corner.The picture is excellent. The sound is very good.  Picture resolution is definitely better than the plasmas, almost so much that movies' special effects look a little less convincing.  I haven't yet tried a football game on it, which is where the plasmas shine, and which is about the only reason to watch TV.  However, it is in my daughter's bedroom so that may not be relevant.The bottom line is that I would definitely buy this Samsung model again.

Reviews.Title: Great picture/sound/features
Reviews.Author: J. Beck
Reviews.Content: This was the first TV I've purchased in the last decade that I actually did research on - I purchased a few with roommates who pretty much got talked into whatever model the guy at Best Buy told them to.  From the get-go this one was on my radar, but checking them out in person at a local big box shop was the final straw.  There were a few TV's that really stood out picture wise, but this one was the best...and the cheapest.I watch some TV on it, but I bought it primarily for my PS3 - and it shines for both gaming and Bluray.  The one feature I knew of and thought was going to be somewhat beneficial was the USB port - I use it constantly with one of my external hard drives.  Was planning on rigging up my computer to a KVM switch to go between my monitor and TV but now there's no need.  I had low hopes for compatibility from hearing other systems constantly failing to play .mpeg or .avi formats, I've yet to find something the TV doesn't play natively.All said and done it's a fantastic TV and the fact that it's less expensive than it competition just seals the deal.

Reviews.Title: A Great Choice
Reviews.Author: Donald A. Beech
Reviews.Content: After spending many hours over a number of months researching various possibilities for my first HDTV, I zeroed in on this Samsung model, which fit all of my criteria and had received numerous excellent reviews. After two months, I am very pleased and completely satisfied with this TV's performance. Shipping was arranged promptly and smoothly; set-up was easy on my own (although it took me a while to figure out that I had to loosen the screws a bit in the stand to allow the screen to swivel); and programming was fine using the manual. Although I am only an occasional TV and movie watcher, it is so enjoyable now to view programming in true high definition. I highly recommend this model if the specs meet your requirements.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Gary S. "Gary"
Reviews.Content: TV was purchased a month ago and we've been very pleased.  Package arrived on the date scheduled, and was light enough for a single person to carry and set up.  Pay attention to the note in the instructions about placing the TV on the stand while upright, NOT lying down, or it could end up crooked.  It was a bit of a pain removing & re-inserting the stand to fix the slight tilt that I created.While my DVR shows are still in SD (hurry up Ceton), playing HD/1080p videos via the USB port blows me away every time.  It's played all formats of videos I've attempted via USB (TS, MKV, AVI).  Was on the fence regarding the 60Hz vs. 120Hz before purchase, but would strongly recommend 120Hz now.  Downloaded some HD Desperate Housewives episodes for my wife and she said it's like watching them in real life.Sound quality, while not great, is what I'd expect for the size/locations of the speakers.  Perfect for our bedroom, but would recommend something external for a larger room.  Video quality during gaming (XBox360) was a bit off until I enabled the 'Game Mode' but now it's perfect.  Using it as a PC monitor via the PC input looks great too.

Reviews.Title: Bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Crosley B. Jackson
Reviews.Content: After ordering one for my parents, I talked myself into buying one for myself.  I've only had it for a week, but the picture looks incredible.  No complaints.  For the cost, I don't think you can beat it.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture, quality tv
Reviews.Author: R. Dombroski
Reviews.Content: I love this TV, it was easy to set up , easy to use, terrific picture quality, great value. I bought a 40" should have picked up a bigger one but this was what I wanted to pay, no regrets.

Reviews.Title: Blows my 40XBR6 out of the water
Reviews.Author: evalam23
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say, an awesome TV, watched Avatar on Blu-Ray and it was simply amazing, I even watched it on a upconverted DVD player and it still looked good.  Love rewatching (not sure if that is a word) Lord of the Rings upconverted to 1080p.  My Sony XBR6 which is not that old does not even compete.  The only problem when you watch something on a 40 inch with this much clarity you are wanting a bigger picture.  I bought this TV because it was under $800, free shipping and all the positive reviews.  Cannot complain was almost ready to buy another one cause the picture was that good.  You know recession and all, so I will just sit back and enjoy this TV hooked up to my PS3, even played some MW2 with my laptop hooked up with HDMI and that was awesome.  If you are looking for 40 inch that has a great picture for under 800 look no further.There is one thing to point out and that is sound sometimes comes in and out playing a few video games with my PS3, not sure what that is all about.  Might buy the 3 year warranty just in case.  Things just not made like they used to be, if you know what I mean.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Admin "Church Lady"
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd Samsung tv and we are very happy customers. It does everything you expect and nothing you don't. I watched PT109, a 1963 movie, the other night and it was amazing! We added the Sony sound bar system and together, it is great. Watching network tv would be okay with the tv audio, but I would not enjoy music over the tv or movies as much if we were using the tv's sound system. We didn't expect a tv to have great sound, so bottom line is we love everything about it. We thought it to be a very good value considering all the alternatives.The product was delivered to us by Pilot Services and they did a very good job. They had me inspect the box before opening it, and put the stand together expertly (even looked at the instructions!) They took the packaging away with them and the delivery man was very professional.It took longer than I expected, and all other pieces of our purchase had arrived prior to the tv getting here. I had read so many reviews saying the tv was delivered in 4 days, etc., I expected a similar experience. I tracked the product through Amazon for a 6 days before it showed that the tv was in transit. When we got a call from Pilot, we accepted the first option for delivery they had available. All told, it was 9 days for us to get the tv. Buyers should be aware that there is no guarantee of a 4-day deliver experience.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Television!
Reviews.Author: David P.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV as an upgrade from a 26" LCD screen, and I have not regretted buying it at all! I was a bit skeptical to buy a 120 Hz TV since sometimes the picture frame rate can look pretty crazy, but this TV has the option to opt to 60 Hz if you so desire. The 120,000:1 contrast ratio is unbelievable, as is the picture in general. It's such a sleek, attractive design as well. The speakers on the TV are alright--I don't use them though. I use the optical digital audio out to hook it up to my sound system. Regardless, you can not go wrong by purchasing this TV!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV, can do without Auto Motion Plus
Reviews.Author: KR "Tall Guy"
Reviews.Content: I agonized over whether to buy a 40" TV with 120hz or a larger TV at 60hz.  I wound up going with the 40" 120hz from Samsung with the hope that the higher refresh rate would make the picture unbeatable.Many people have noticed that the 120hz TVs from Samsung make the picture look like it was filmed with a camcorder, or look like soap-opera video quality, which is not all that desirable.  It turns out that this is really because of a technology that Samsung uses to "upconvert" form the 60hz broadcasts of digital cable and DVDs to 120hz.  This is the Auto Motion Plus feature.  Turning it off makes the picture look normal, and slightly enhanced from a 60hz TV.  There sometimes is a "choppy" look, but this is most likely just how a "lower quality" signal looks on a "higher quality" display, sort of like how standard definition video looks awful on a high definition TV.  However, the picture looks great, and there is no blur, as well as there being vivid colors.So what's the point of 120hz?  Well, essentially you are "future-proofing" your TV, since television and Bluray discs will most likely broadcast at the higher rate within the next few years, and that will undoubtedly look incredible on a 120hz TV.My recommendation?  The TV is great, and if you buy this then you probably will enjoy it more with the Auto Motion Plus turned off.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic for the Price
Reviews.Author: Annette
Reviews.Content: I've been watching this TV since February and in order to take advantage of the promotion prices finally decided to bite the bullet. If you want a quality, top rated 40"-42" TV for between $700-$800, this is the one to get. This Samsung TV replaces a 3 year old 37" 720P Sharp Aquos that was excellent for it's day but doesn't come close to this 40" Samsung. The clarity of the 1080p 120Hz vs the 720p 60Hz of the Sharp is like night and day. I looked at it in the store next to a 40" 1080p 120Hz Samsung LED TV and could not tell the difference. Honestly, the clarity is so dramatic it takes a little getting used to.The only problem I had was getting the TV on the stand. The directions are poor and it took a friend who also has a Samsung to show me what I was doing wrong. If you have the same problem, be aware that the TV actually slides ONTO the base, it does not sit against the vertical section of the L bracket. If you do that you won't be able to get the screw holes to line up.I am loving this TV. I had rented Sherlock Homes in HD and it was the first movie I viewed on this TV...I was blown away by the detail. Everyone has their own personal preferences for the settings but the Dynamic option is awsome for everyday viewing.I highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: nice mid level hdtv
Reviews.Author: andy
Reviews.Content: We have had our Sammy now for just over a month. The good: black levels are deep--comparable to that of a low-end plasma, the factory corrective electronics do a nice job cleaning up bad TV signals, the adjustments are infinitely flexible--and simultaneously maddening if you are in any way OCD about visual picture quality, it has a slender frame for its picture size, the fit and finish of the TV are visually appealing, judder is kept to a minimum for the most part--except on a few, old slow-panning scenes. The bad: I have one stuck pixel--red, and it drives me slightly crazy...and it will not go away. I understand that you need a min. of 5 such pixels for them to consider it a defective display. Also, the sound is not so good. Please plug this TV into a good surround system to do it justice. The 2x10w speakers are tinny and somewhat harsh sounding. The display will tell you that it is operating at 60 HZ, but this is a misnomer. Your input is coming in at 60 HZ, but your display is still operating at 120 Hz...if that makes any sense. Overall, we're pleased with our purchase and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product & Service
Reviews.Author: RGC
Reviews.Content: After researching numerous reviews and checking out Cnet's review on the "Best cheap TVs" [...] we decided to go with the Samsung LNC630.  So far it has been a great TV with no issues after 2 months

Reviews.Title: Important first impression issues
Reviews.Author: RPGer "another opinion"
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BE ALARMED IF THE TLEVISION DOESN'T MEET YOUR EXPECTATIONS WHEN YOU TURN IT ON FOR THE FIRST TIME! You are only a few tweaks away from an excellent picture.This review is only about first day setup and viewing; I've only had the set 3 days so anything else is premature.The first evening I felt I had made a terrible mistake or had a lemon.  I have a Playstation 3 and expected it could only be a better experience than it was when played on the 2.5 year old 26" LG entry level I replaced. If there were shadows, the screen became virtually unviewable; if the character passed a window with sunlight comine in, the whole screen would flash brightly.I went through the user manual - I am comfortable with electronics, but the information in the manual is very poorly written with little practical instruction; for example, there was a brief mention of a game mode (the comments about using the game mode indicated diminishment in the quuality of the image, the image shaking... based on all that negative information why would they even have a game mode?)  Further, I could not even find the game mode option (when directed to it by tech support the following morning, it was not an intuitive path at all).The next morning technical support was fairly helpful, after first suggesting setting up a service call before offering any information  - the fix to the screen blacking out in shadows was very simple: turn off the "EcoSmart" (there is a case of over kill: having the power consumption change second to second is one of those features that I am sure CNET will say to ignore.So, after experimenting with various settings adjustments the picture looks good, and I can get evening lighting in a game. I'm not done trying to optimize the picture, but a bit at a time.  I am comfortable with the purchase now.As I said, I wouldn't review anything I just bought, but the fact the default settings are not optimal and that the owner manual is really subpar robbed me of the pleasure of a new upgraded television.On balance, I am really pleased by the high sound quality from the built in speakers.  I am confident the major problems are far-less-than-optimal presets,and a user manual that should be a major cause of embarrassment to Samsung.It doesn't even include the specs; that first night I was questioning if it really was 120 refresh - Playstation was the only screen that showed rates, and that was 60!

Reviews.Title: Died Shortly after Arrival
Reviews.Author: J.D.H
Reviews.Content: After carefully setting up this brand new Samsung LN40C630 TV it died after 10 minutes of first use. As a precaution I even waited 24 hours for 1st power up because of somewhat cold temperatures during shipping.Shut down & wouldn't turn on again. After consulting with Samsung support it was determined that there was a power issue that would require a technician from Samsung to come out in a week or more. I decided to return to Amazon thanks to their very generous & simple return policy. It's very disappointing but might have been damaged in shipping?I will give this model another chance because of all the great reviews but Amazon is now out of stock. Will find local source for same.Amazon made return easy & effortless.Still very disappointed,though....

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: Brad Smith
Reviews.Content: I am quite impressed by this lcd tv, which I bought after Black Friday at a great price of $599. The picture is a vast improvement over my old 32 inch Samsung, acquired in early 07 for more than double the cost. This model also boasts what I consider almost astoundingly good sound. Coupled with an Insignia internet blu-ray player, the sound of Pandora on here is better than with any dvd and almost good enough as not to require any type of external speakers. I am not sure why this is, but the sound is many times better than on my older Samsung tv. I have not even fiddled with the display controls yet, and am perfectly satisfied with how this tv looks. The multitude of display options is mind-boggling. Most of the normal dvds that I watch are in 720p, so they do not even take advantage of the tv's 1080p capacities. As far as the 120hz feature, I'm sure that makes a difference, too, but I am not qualified to judge it over the older 60hz models. It does look good. If you want a great tv that looks better than anything you could imagine just a few years ago, then you can do little better than this one.

Reviews.Content: I have had several very good TVs in my life, but this one has blown me away. I got this one for the bedroom. The image is so perfect it just looks like one is right there, being part of the scene. The stereo surround sound is excellent even without any extra speakers. On HD channels the degree of perfection is such that it looks like one is watching a 3D movie. I just wish all channels were on HD. We have been with Dish Network for ten years and decided to upgrade to a new HDTV receiver. Out of a total of about 140 channels, we get some 40 or 42 HD channels, and those are the only ones I now watch. Since this HDTV arrived, I have even found myself watching certain uninteresting or silly movies that I would have never watched before. But with this HDTV even the stupidest movies seem attractive and serve the purpose of testing the excellent quality of the picture and the stereo surround sound on this tv. My laptop has blu-ray so I hooked the laptop to the TV to watch two blu-ray movies and both the image and the sound are also spectacular. On top of it, this TV has a beautiful design; it's the most elegant LCD HDTV I have seen. To me, this HDTV has it ALL. Boy, am I happy I got it!I have aso fallen in love with the remote. It is the nicest, most user-friendly remote I have ever had, with big numbers and light too. As we are with Dish we need to use the Dish remote to switch channels, but I love this remote so I use it for everything else.(Concerning the manual, it has such a small font that I don't even feel like reading it. This is something most manuals from most manufacturers need to look into.)

Reviews.Content: As a tech junkie, I have been through my fair share of high-end televisions. This is honestly the best one I have owned to date. Samsung continues to impress me with their line of televisions. The 120 hertz refresh rate makes the picture quality incredible smooth and the picture is so sharp and clear that I actually feel like the people on the screen are sitting right in front of me. The hint of grey is also a nice touch in my living room and should work well with just about any set-up. Very easy to install. Has several USB ports and has the same audio jack that your computer has so you can plug in a set of speakers if you want. The sound is the only thing that is a little underperforming. But it's nothing that a decent set of speakers can't fix. Overall, this is an incredible TV and definitely worth the price, which I thought was already low :).

Reviews.Title: Even a used version is amazing
Reviews.Author: Sean Hopkins
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for a new TV for a long time and decided that I could afford this one. I think Samsung makes the best LCDs & LEDs out there is terms of picture quality and TV set designs.I took a chance and ordered a Used edition from Amazon Warehouse that was listed in very good condition and saved about $100 off new price. With my Amazon Prime account 1-Day shipping was only $4.99. Brilliant!The TV came UPS and the box was brand new, there was a fist-sized hole punctured in the back of the box and my heart sank. When I opened it up there was not a single scratch anywhere on the unit, infact there was no sign that anyone had ever touched this TV before. Must've been cosmetic packaging damage. Feeling better about buying a like new used LCD TV through the mail!This set looks great! It took about 5min to set the TV on the stand and screw in the bolts holding it in place. This TV is LIGHT! My old 32" tv weighed almost 80lbs, this set is about 30lbs.I have a PS3, 360, Wii, Cable TV, and Computer hooked into this thing and all them look great. I run my computer through a DVI => HDMI cable and it displays in perfect resolution, Hulu looks great! Game mode did seem to help my game session with some BlOps on PS3, did seem to improve initial controller lag.Games look great, movies look great, Blu-Ray looks awesome. I watched some Planet Earth and was blown away. My old set was an HD, but this is like looking a real HD set. Very nice black levels.I didn't play around with the settings too much, but for me the Dynamic picture setting was brightest and most vibrant. I do have what after researching on AVS forums the lower end display chip, but I haven't any issues after the 1st week. I will update this review if anything goes pear-shaped.Some people may not think the speaker are good, but I don't turn them past 20 and they are loud as hell. When watching something while going to sleep I have to turn it down to around 7 to not be too loud in the house. So speakers are really nice for built it units. They actually sound better than my 10yr old micro-speaker 5.1 system.Well thats it. Good TV, get the bigger version if you can afford it, or hell get some LED action if you can afford that, but this is an amazing buy for those looking for a great TV for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Why LG may be a better choice than Samsung!
Reviews.Author: Internet shopper "Retired but not tired!"
Reviews.Content: This brief review compares certain features of the LG 42LD550 with Samsung LN40C630.These features applies to all sizes of the LG LD550 series and the Samsung C630 series.I had the opportunity to test both TV sets side by side (See Technical Problem below).IN GENERAL- First of all the pictures on both TVs are outstanding.- I did not notice any imperfections in the LCD display on either set.- The base on the Samsung is of superior quality and very rigid whereas the LG model is a bit flimsy (this is irrelevant if you mount the TV on the wall).- The remote controls are comparable however the Samsung has built-in light and the LG does not.- The LG's price tag was $78 higher than the Samsung however the screen on the LG is two inches bigger and the LG has more features (details below)TECHNICAL PROBLEMOne of my objectives was to view MP4 video from a USB hard drive and from USB memory sticks.The Samsung would play part of the MP4 movies and suddenly stop then skip to the next movie when playing from either the stick or the hard drive.It would play 1 hour 25 minutes and 43 seconds of two of the movies and only 24 minutes of a third movie.I tried a 30 Gb and 8 Gb formatted with NTFS and FAT32 respectively.Yes, I verified that the latest software/firmware was installed by connecting the TV to the internet via the Ethernet port.I tried both USB ports but the problem remained.SAMSUNG "TECHNICAL SERVICE"The Samsung customer service rep explained "that this TV model was not designed to play full MP4 movies, only short clips".She offered to schedule a service visit but made it very clear that they would charge me for a service visit if they did not find a problem with their hardware.I talked to two representatives and finally asked to talk with a technical service rep. They promised me that he would call me back within 24 hours.I eventually gave up waiting, returned the TV and ordered the LG for an additional $78 instead.Nobody from Samsung has ever called me back (it has now been weeks).WHY LG MAY BE A BETTER CHOICEThe LG model has no problems playing my MP4 videos. It plays from my 1 TB hard drive and any USB memory stick (FAT32 or NTFS format).It will even play M4V video which is Apple's file extension for MP4 containers.Here is the best part!Apart from the extra 2 inches (screen size) the LG model offers:1) Netcast, providing direct access to online viewing of Netflix, YouTube, Yahoo weather (and others).2) Free Nero MediaHome 4 CD opening up for Digital Living (DLNA) capability allowing you to access wired or wireless computers or other networked devices throughout your home to the TV.NETCASTUsing the Netcast feature, I no longer have to have my laptop PC connected to the TV to watch NETFLIX and it appears that the picture and sound quality is better than via a connected PC. Also I like to be able to select, start/stop and pause the movies from the LG remote.The TV has the RGB and stereo mini plug for a PC in case you still want to hook one up.I connected the TV to my home network by wire because I like the "wired" Ethernet speed and reliability (wireless is also available - see other reviews for details).NETFLIX was very easy to set up. Simply push the Netcast button on the LG remote, click on the Netflix icon. Enter the code displayed on the TV on your PC and you can start watching Netflix movies (obviously you must have a Netflix account or sign up for one). For only $8 per month you can watch unlimited movies without commercials. (I have come to realize that life is too short to spend part of watching TV commercials).DLNA (Digital Living Network Association)Installing Nero on my computers allows the TV to access any drive on my network. From the LG remote I can browse all Music, Video and Family pictures stored anywhere on our home network (Nero requires you to allow access to the specific folders before the TV is allowed access).The LG rep informed me that TVersity software (free) will also work as an alternative to Nero (I have not tried it yet).INITIAL SETUPThe initial setup was equally easy for both brands. The Samsung software/firmware was up to date. It took a short while for the LG to update from version 06.01.05 to 08.02.16 which may be because LG issues updates when new Netcast services comes online.The initial channel lineup was easier to manage on the Samsung.LG CUSTOMER SERVICEThe TV arrived without the Nero CD.I therefore called LG customer service. They told me that they may not be able to ship the missing CD. Instead they suggested I download the trial version from Nero.I therefore contacted Amazon Customer Service and they instructed LG to send me the CD. LG has confirmed that it "is in the mail".I am still waiting for the CD (at the time of this writing).I am currently using the Nero trial version which does not support MP4!!!CONCLUSION$78 extra for the LG TV provides a lot of additional functionality and 2 inches extra.

Reviews.Content: This television has great picture and sound.  However, buyers should be aware that it has limited internet capacity.  The manual states that by purchasing the Samsung Linksys wireless adapter (from $60 to $80) one can connect to a wireless router--which is true.  And this connection does provide internet access.However, the wireless internet access is fairly useless.  Samsung is currently promoting internet apps for its TVs, which include Netflix, Pandora, Napster, etc.  Be aware that this TV does not support these.  The only thing the Linksys adapter allows one to do is to connect to a local network.  I really don't see the point of an internet connection that does not do anything.Needless to say, I was greatly disappointed to discover I had to purchase a propietary Samsung adapter to get wireless support, only to discover that one cannot do anything useful with the wireless connection--apart from share files on a PC.Customer service is also less than satisfactory. It took me almost a week to receive a response to my question about app support, to which I received a one sentence response.Would I recommend the TV?  Yes.  But I would warn against purchasing the additional Linksys Adapter.  If you want streaming, go with a product like Roku.
