Reviews.Title: Great LCD TV; Minor complaints about media file handling and other.
Reviews.Author: Jason Farrell
Reviews.Content: After our 32" Westinghouse LCD gave up the ghost, I upgraded to this 40" Samsung LCD after a bunch of research (a 42" LG was the runner up). The first LCD that was delivered had an apparent power supply problem, as the TV would randomly turn itself off and refuse to turn back on, unless left unplugged for hours. Amazon quickly shipped a replacement, free of charge, and this replacement has worked flawlessly ever since.I love everything about this TV, but especially the vivid color (in standard mode), automatic brightness adjustment to save eyes and energy, the great built-in audio, the usbkey media support, and the clean look of both the LCD and even its stand.A few minor complaints (in order of annoyance):1) I can't use the Samsung Remote control android app with this TV because the Samsung LN40C630 doesn't have the "Internet@TV" feature that 650 series and above have. Should've bought it instead.2) 120Hz video smoothing looks like crap, so I've disabled it, HOWEVER, that setting appears to be ignored when playing content off a usbkey(!!!), so movies still have that 'homevideo' smoothed look.3) There's a known problem with playing 720p h264 MKV video files from a usbkey, where the audio is always out of sync by a few milliseconds. Still hasn't been fixed by a firmware update (but hey, most TVs can't play MKV video at all).4) It takes a looong time for this TV to turn on (what seems like 10 seconds), but hopefully that's a good tradeoff for saving power (haven't yet hooked my kill-a-watt meter up to see how much phantom power it's using when 'off').5) DLNA still isn't very compatible (especially with linux servers), so I'm not using it. Using usbkey sneakernet instead.6) The TV supports ext3fs formatted usbkeys, but not ext2, or ext4 (which is needed for playing back files larger than the FAT 4GB limit).

Reviews.Title: A Great TV For Video Games, Movies, and Cable!
Reviews.Author: Mark Elders
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV a little over a year ago, and since then, I have used it extensively and love it!  The picture is great (after you change the picture to standard settings and not dynamic) and really smooth no matter what you use the TV for!Last school year, I had a Wii, a PS3, a PS2, and an XBox 360 hooked up to the TV at once, and with the Game Mode setting on, the games were smooth and looked incredible!  I can't even describe how good games like Metal Gear Solid 4, Uncharted 2, Mass Effect 2, and Portal 2 look on this TV!I've also watched a great deal of Blu-rays with this TV via my PS3, and you can definitely tell a difference between DVDs and Blu-rays!  Blu-rays make movies like The Dark Knight, Inception, and The Imaginarium of Dr. Parnassus look incredible, of course, but they even make The Office and The Social Network look great!Also, HD channels look incredibly clear with this TV.  Basketball games are so much clearer with HD channels coming through this TV!Even non-HD sources look significantly better on this TV than they would on non-HD TVs.So the picture is great, I've established that, but what about the other features?  Well, the sound is superb.  I feel no pressing need to buy any sort of external sound system for this TV.  Also, it has a lot of nice features that you can adjust at will.  You can set it such that the brightness adjusts to the lighting of the room.  You can let certain external devices control the TV to an extent. (When I turn on my PS3, it turns on my TV and switches it to the correct HDMI port.  I have had a couple problems with this, but they are few and far between.  Turning off the feature will obviously fix said problems.)  The TV has plenty of ports as well: 4 HDMI, 2 Component, 2 AVI, 1 DVI, 2 USB, 1 LAN, and others that I have never used.This is the best TV I have ever owned, and I'm sure I will use it for years and years.

At the time it was around $3500 and no less a huge risk to buy over the internet.  When the delivery service dropped it off, they waited to have me plug it in and test it before leaving.  It was a great experience.  When it came time to get a second TV, there was no reason to even try another MFG or seller.  I purchased a 40 inch Samsung and they dropped it off when I wasn't available.  It turns out the glass was broke, but AMAZON shipped a replacement within 12 hours....(I opened the box and discovered the problem on Sunday because of being out of town)  The new TV shipped at 7 AM Monday morning.  Amazon and Samsung is a perfect combination.  Samsung is a great product and Amazon knows how take care of their customers IF something goes wrong.  I have never had a problem but this first was handled flawelessly.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy (consumer reports recommended)
Reviews.Author: calty
Reviews.Content: For the price this TV is excellent.  Paid $650(Amazon) and couldn't be happier.  Samsung makes great TVs, from plasmas (though not as good as Panasonic)to high and low end HD models and the picture on all of them is excellent (family owns a few).  With 1080p and 120Hz this TV is ahead of the curve (especially since no channels are broadcast in 1080p...yet, blue ray and netflix movies are which is why I got this model...don't use the 120Hz unless watching basketball games which I watch a lot of, I use the clear setting, don't need it for baseball).  Two complaints: one is that channels that aren't broadcast in HD really don't look that good, so basically I only watch stations that are broadcast in HD and those look great.  Other problem is the sound going from shows to commercials, however every TV I've owned over the last 15 years have had this problem, HD or not.  Don't use any of the features so can't comment on them.  Try not to pay any attention to the way people say this TV should be set up, looks great right out of the box.  Only changed few things, the backlight setting, lowered it to get deeper blacks.  Set Dynamic contrast to medium, set tint slightly to the green end G57/R43, people faces were slightly pink/reddish and set Edge Enhancement to on.Plain and simple this TV is worth every penny, most importantly HD channels look great.

Reviews.Title: Issues with Over the air channels
Reviews.Author: Bharathi Selvaraj "Bharathi"
Reviews.Content: Based on my usage, before I returned the product for a refundPros:1) Picture quality was really good2) Played movies and songs from connected external hard disk through USB3) Shared programs through wired network worked fine.4) Sound is reasonably ok.Cons:I tried with three different indoor antennas, but "over the air channels didn't work well". I had to return the TV and I got a replacement.  Still the replaced TV had the same issue.When I ran the auto program, it memorized the channels properly and HD channel reception in particular was very clear.  However, when I kept changing channels and once it detected a weak channel, it corrupted every other channel (nothing appeared).  Also, it slowed down the main menu while changing different options.  I think most people use cable at home and never noticed this issue.  So far I could find only one reviewer at bestbuy.com mentioned this issue.Samsung customer care was not good enough to resolve this issue.  They sent a technician who replaced the TV tuner and still couldn't resolve it.  However, I am extremely happy with the way amazon handled this issue and I hope to get my refund soon

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Artwork
Reviews.Author: B. Yun "None"
Reviews.Content: I bought this 40 inch samsung LCD TV from Amazon.com last week. Up to this moment, I am happy with this guy.It is easy to install, nice quality of picture and easy streaming from my PC.I have no problem to watch some BR grade movie files in my PC using streaming via PC share manager.If the life of back light last longer, I'd be very happy.It is a nice deal.

Reviews.Title: Better than my Sharp Aquos
Reviews.Author: diyguy
Reviews.Content: Simply fantastic.  Once you select the option for 120Hz (fast motion), you will be amazed.  I'm thinking about getting another one for the master bedroom.  It is definitely worth the money. No complaints so far.  The picture is so sharp and clear.  All I can say is Wow, way to go Samsung. Don't stop making this model.

Reviews.Title: Sound suggestion
Reviews.Author: Dennis3D
Reviews.Content: I really love this TV's picture. It's a great purchase and Amazon has been a good partner. The one thing about the TV that needs to be enhanced is the sound. I've read a lot of posts regarding the improvement of sound for HD TV's. I was mainly looking at soundbar reviews. From Samsung to Sony. There wasn't a simple solution, each product had one little or major concern. From glitches to too much bulky equipment.I already have a great radio with rich sound. The Cambridge Works I765. I was wondering if it were possible to hook this up to my TV. After a little research I purchased a 6 ft audio cable (3.5mm male to 3.5 male). I plugged one end into the TV's audio out and the other end into the radio's Aux. Bingo! Great sound for all programs, whether they be Roku, Blue Ray, or regular TV.I can have the TV's sound and the radio's sound on together. I have the radio's sound set at 10 and the TV's at 22. The blend is perfect. The radio does a great job clearing up muddy dialogue and the bass is terrific. It's not surround sound but it was a simple solution with very satisfying results.Thus if you already have a radio with great sound, try this out and save yourself a few hundred dollars.

Reviews.Title: LCD Love
Reviews.Author: KB
Reviews.Content: I did about 3 months of research before purchasing this tv.  Lots of great reviews and features to this tv.  I am very pleased with the picture quality.  It is crystal clear.  I am having some issues with the sound quality; am thinking about purchasing a sound bar?  I read all the amazon reviews in hopes of finding a solution to some issues with motion.  Lots of comments about turning the Auto Motion Plus feature Off; which i have already done.  The motion problem only appears on certain shows that have a lot of back and forth panning with the camera.  One reviewer suggested switching to the sport mode or gaming mode when necessary.Overall, i am very happy with the tv.  There is so many ways to make adjustments to suit your every need.  The 40" size is perfect for our family room.  We watched a DVD the other night and it was the clearest picture i have ever seen.Great price, great tv; sit back and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: Jack B.
Reviews.Content: This TV provides a nice picture straight out of the box, but I would recommend taking some time to adjust the picture settings. After a little bit of tweaking this TV will look amazing. A quick Google search will give you plenty of recommended settings and you can find which one works best for you. Do not hesitate to buy this TV, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Nice set if you don't need apps
Reviews.Author: DDudek
Reviews.Content: This TV is a great choice for people who do not need internet applications (Netflix, Amazon VOD, Pandora, etc).  The picture quality and sound are great and the sleek profile fits in most rooms.  I have been using the TV for 3 months now and have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Review
Reviews.Author: KitKat10
Reviews.Content: Moved into new apartment, needed a new TV.  After tons of research, all signs pointed to Samsung.  This really is the best brand out there for the value, definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: Good but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: The set up was beyond easy.  You just turn it on and unless you need special setups because of things I do not understand, I used the basic defaults.  The actual apperaance of the tv is amazing.  It is beautiful and really looks great in a living room--not at all clunky and really looks modern.  The video quality is beyond good.  It is amazing.  Just two problems which may not even have to do with the tv.  When using my Apple Tv on the TV the sound will turn off for about 5 second sat a time at random.  It is incredibly frustrating after a while.  Problem 2 when turning on the tv it can take up to 5 second for the tv to turn on and sometimes you think it hasn't turned on so you accidentally press it again.  This sounds like a small issue but after a while sitting for 5 second to wait and see if you first try had worked can be really annoying!

Reviews.Title: Great purchase!
Reviews.Author: Ann Marie
Reviews.Content: I took my time researching this purchase and am very pleased with itsperformance. The difference in picture quality from prior set is amazing.There is a slight volume issue on HD channels it is lower and has to be increasedthen it is too high when you switch channels. Small price to pay but it wouldbe ideal if Samsung could rectify.I would definitely buy from them again.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for price
Reviews.Author: Reviewer_123
Reviews.Content: Didnt know what to expect when I ordered this TV but when the PS3 is plugged in with games or Blu-Ray movies it looks great.Killzone 3 looks fantastic on this TV in case anyone is wondering.Pros: Great Price, Awesome Quality, Sound is better than you would think.Cons: Only con is the fact that non-HD cable looks a little grainy but with the correct settings adjustments it looks better.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use - Great quality
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: Since I have gotten it, I have not been disappointed. It came in the box that you would buy it in the store and normally I am hesitant when shipping big items like it. UPS took very good care of it and you have to sign for it in order to get the TV.So, after signing for it, I opened up the box. Found the base and it was easy to set up. Make sure you have to persons handy because you will need it in order for the TV not to smash on the ground. I plugged every cable in the right spot, turned it on and the picture was great. The menu is easy to navigate through and after changing some of the settings for my likings, got it to work. I realized my cable was not in HD and it clearly made a difference. After calling and upgrading, the 120HZ was amazing and did its job.Make sure when you buy a blu-ray player that the output will be 120HZYou will not regret this item!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 40" TV nicely made
Reviews.Author: tkdgal
Reviews.Content: I wanted a good quality HDTV that was easy to use and had PC capability but on a budget.  The picture quality is outstanding. It also works wonderfully well hooking up the Mac and using it as a huge screen to oversee the kids activities on it.  With WI-FI to the mac - we can access anything over the internet without paying the price for a "internet ready HDTV".  Huge savings... Only draw backs - took a while to figure out the remote and some programming. Haven't yet hooked it up through the stereo system and the sound quality (particularly the volume control) is not ideal.  Some of that is the broadcaster's responsibility - but for some channels - have to turn the volume all most all the way up to normally hear.  Sometimes there's been a strange occasionally click or snap in the sound but again only with certain channels. Also,love all the extra output options so that I don't have to keep changing everyting between the various consoles the kids add to it.

Reviews.Title: We're quite pleased with it.
Reviews.Author: jerseyboy
Reviews.Content: The TV produces an outstanding picture. It's hooked up to a Samsung BD-6900 Blu-ray which is wi-fi enabled. The combo streams nicely from Netflix.Setup is a bit clunky and counter-intuitive, but this can be said of every manufacturer.I'd advise turning off the BD-Wise communication feature.As far as setttings, every room is different. Play with them.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture
Reviews.Author: M. Writtle "MurrayW"
Reviews.Content: This looks great and gives a crisp colourful picture for a great price. Very happy. Have only used with output from a PC and from a standard DVD player. The output from the DVD player was a revelation after a CRT TV. It eliminates a layer of abstraction and gives a very strong sense of "being there".

Reviews.Title: can i change
Reviews.Author: can i change
Reviews.Content: hi i am from australia and i would like to buy this tv but i am worried that i cannot charge the power cord so it will fit australian plugs is there some way of doing this all is it just the hdmi cable that needs to be changed so my question is can i change the cord without buying a adapter to a australian plug and will this tv work in australia the same

Reviews.Title: Fantastic color
Reviews.Author: pyrofan
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest color tv I have owned...have own Sony, JVC, Sharp actually just about every brand made.The Samsung LN40C630 was purchased to replace a 32" Sony LCD. It was supposed to be used as a seconded viewed TV but right now we watch it more than our 50" Sony LCD. A lot probably has to do with the 120 Hz refresh rate and the 1080p versus the 60Hz and 720p on the Sony. Very Pleased.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Product Thus Far
Reviews.Author: Amanda Bazan
Reviews.Content: Well, I've had the TV for about a month now and I have been very pleased. I did a good deal of research before making this purchase. It was between this TV and the comprable Sony model. With the Sony, I felt like I'd be paying a little bit more for the name. I did get a chance to see the TV in person at best buy before I made the purchase online (which was important to me). I don't have a lot of experience with HD...but I am VERY happy with product.The picture: The quality is excellent. I have DirectTV and the HD channels are beautiful.The setup: very simple - 4 HDMI ports made the setup easy. Out of the box, I was watching TV and BluRays in 15 minutes.The Sound: Good not great. I don't have a very big living room, so it works very well for me. But if you have a stereo system this doesn't matterThe appearance: Pretty sleek looking TV. Not as thin as some of the high end models, but At this price point, it's as good looking of a set as I found.Features: I'm not one to use the TV to get online...so this doesn't matter nearly as much to me. I've got Wii that I use to stream Netflix and the picture is very nice. 4 HDMI ports (I'm only using two - DirectTV and bluray). The bluray looks fantastic.Overall: definetly a very nice TV, particularly for the price! There are certainly TVs with more bells and whistles; but if you're looking for a very good picture and very good price, this is an excellent choice.The one thing I can't comment on is the durability...I've only owned it a month, but if this changes I'll update the review.

Reviews.Title: Fully satisfy
Reviews.Author: Gek "Gek"
Reviews.Content: I like the TV I bought, had received some return as lowest price was guaranteed. Expect the further price decreased on Samsung to get new 55" TV, because loved the quality of the new one.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN40C630
Reviews.Author: djarcher
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the quick delivery. Exterior of box was perfect( no holes) and delivery person was very curtious. Unit was in perfect condition and was setup and working within 60 minutes. Picture is excellent and my son ( who this was purchased for) could not be happier. For the price I don't think you could find a better unit, and expect it will provide great service for several years.

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: Raymond
Reviews.Content: I'll let all the self-appointed electronic technology experts and critics give all the finer details of performance and visual quality.  All I can say is my new Samsung 40" HDTV is the best I have ever seen and satisfies my long desire for great high definition TV watching.

Reviews.Title: Is this TV worth the price?
Reviews.Author: vaporcat
Reviews.Content: This is an awsome televison. I was not sure if I wanted to spend this much money but after reading reviews decided this was the one for me. When I got it installed and saw the picture quality I knew I had made the right decision. This is worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Michael West
Reviews.Content: and price to match.  I bought this TV from Amazon for $649.00 and I am glad I did since the next lowest seems to be  around $800.00 and Amazon doesn't seem to have anymore in stock.  Great picture and easy to set up.  The sound quality is good.  Lots of features for the price.  I have hooked it up to my FIOS via HDMI cable.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: dlp
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a new television for our basement family room where I could watch sports and other shows while my wife watches our tv on the main level.  I wish I could switch them now as I feel that this picture is far superior to one we regularly use.  I am very pleased with it and considering the price that just makes it that much better.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Assassin715
Reviews.Content: I love this TV it is by far the best picture quality I have seen. It has a very bright picture which you can dim if necessary. The screen is matted but not enough to get rid of the glare from the window that is behind me when I watch the TV. It is beautiful and is a great price for the quality. the only thing I found insufficient was the the speakers. The sound quality is pretty bad but you could get use to. I have a home theater so it does not bother me. You can also turn the TV speakers off so it only plays though the home theater only. There is also a ethernet port so you can update the software. There is Picture in Picture but it only works with cable, so no HDMI and component (if you are using HDTV cable box from Comcast with component it does not work). There is Media Play but it does not work with an iPod and there is no apps. I did have a Samsung before and the speakers were better but the picture is truly much better on this model.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great price
Reviews.Author: R. Jarreau
Reviews.Content: I got this TV as a graduation gift in May last year. I am nothing more than completely satisfied with my choice. There is not better TV in this price range. This TV is an all around great TV, but I use it mostly for gaming. The only downside to this TV to me is that from a distance, the remote is a little laggy, and the features and settings are not very newb-friendly, and I only recommended changing the settings if you are experienced. Aside from that, crystal clear picture, great sound, sleek design, the whole package. You will not regret buying this TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN40C630 HDTV
Reviews.Author: Uncle Lars
Reviews.Content: I bought this HDTV as a Christmas gift for my daughter and son-in-law. After some difficulty in setting it up (because of the cable company) they couldn't be more pleased with this LCD HDTV. They love it in every respect.

Reviews.Title: We love it!
Reviews.Author: Bernard I. Birnbaum "Buzz"
Reviews.Content: We have waited to upgrade to a quality flat screen tv and this Samsung 40" LCD was really worh waiting for. It,s a quality and price winner and coupled with our existing sound system, it's truly a joy. Looks great and performs great. We are thrilled.

Reviews.Title: Great purchaSe
Reviews.Author: happytvman
Reviews.Content: I ordered this tv on black friday and have loved every minute of it. The 120hz is perfect for watching basketball and football games, I don't ever want to go without it now. You can't go wrong with a samsung this its the best tv for the price/features.The only thing I've encountered was a couple times I have turned the tv on and there was no sounds coming out of the speakers the only solution was to turn the tv off and on again. This has only happened twice. Another problem was the motorola comcast cable box will have problems after watching tv for a while. After researching the issue I found out its because it uses infrared waves to connect the tv control to the box and the lcd screen gives off infrared waves that, after a while, begin to interfere  with the control, so I had to move the box from under the tv to the side where the signal doesn't have to cross the televisions path.

Reviews.Title: Picture is awesome, range is only average
Reviews.Author: Brian_F
Reviews.Content: My last LCD TV was from 5 yrs ago, and when shopping for it I couldn't tell the difference between brands/models/resolution. Except the cheap-o generic ones like Soyo and Vizio looked slightly worse.  I got a sale-priced, low-end Sony that my Aunt recently bought (she insisted) for a reasonable price and an old compact stereo system.Anyway this time I really could tell the difference. This TV has an excellent picture.  I compared it with Sony, Panasonic, Toshiba, and Sharp at various retail stores. The Samsung was near the top overall, and the price was lower.  120 Hz really makes a difference for sports, etc., and the processing from broadcast signal (I live near the city), looks much less pixelated than I was used to.The only 'problem' was that while the old Sony got all the stations using a paper clip in the coax-in (seriously), for this one I had to get commercial rabbit ears and UHF loop.  Besides the $20 I had to spend on the antenna, this has a great picture and good sound for the money.  Also the remote is fairly intuitive.Amazon had a lower price than the stores, with shipping included.For LCD, my advice is at least to check out Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Geezy
Reviews.Content: I am satisfied with this purchase. The price was right. Amazon shipped it immediately. The only thing I have noticed is that we seem to be changing the volume setting often(commercials,etc.)  That is a control feature I wish it had. Other than that, I like it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: MNOutdoors74
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for 4 months now.  I love it.  The picture quality is great, the features are great, and I have not had any issues at all with it.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Very good TV
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: Great picture and plenty of options to fine tune for your viewing needs. It has very decent sound. No extra speaker needed for my needs. Got the best price at Amazon and the delivery time beat their estimate.

Reviews.Title: Initial reaction:  WOW
Reviews.Author: S. Weaver
Reviews.Content: Basically, the deal is this:  this tv is super sweet - the video quality is incredible.  I have a Samsung 32" LCD with a 60 MHz refresh rate, and the letters that swoop by at the bottom ticker on CNN/ESPN/FAUX News noticeably "ghost", leaving a little white afterimage.  This tv?  Barely, if at all, so the 120 MHz makes a differenct folks.The Auto Motion Plus - this setting does indeed make movies and shows look weird, like soap operas (just trust me) - but, my dear sports fans, when you have the game on it is awesome, just awesome.  (Wish the remote had a shortcut to cycle the AutoMotion Plus options!)Sound - good, and quite loud - I can only go up to about about volume 18 before it is too loud.  In my bedroom, I will not be needing a sound system, so I'm glad the sound is good enough out of the box.Looks and setup - no problems, it was trivial for one person.  The glass base and stand is an elegant touch.Remote - backlit keys, and thoughtfully ergonomic - too bad it won't control my Comcast box.Summary - the only lingering question is durability.  Rest assured that any problems I have will be dutifully reported here in this space.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Charles Blythe
Reviews.Content: We use this TV in our master bedroom. The color is great and the swivel base lets view it from the bed or from the sittng room for maximum comfort. The price was the best part of this purchase.

Reviews.Title: EXCELENT PRODUCT FOR PRICE
Reviews.Author: vinmaur
Reviews.Content: I Purchased this tv samsung LN-40-c630 on 07/06/10 & recieved it by 07/10/10 with very profcient delevery. The delevery people wanted to help with set-up but i declined. I had my cousin help me. IM 53 so i could set it up on my own. The tv has a outstanding picture for my nessesities. I have a X-box 360 & asamsung BD-5500 blu-ray player hooked up with Hdmi cables.I also connected a Samsung Hw-c-450 surround sound bar with wireless subwoffer.Excellent combnation for less than $1200.00 i got a reletivly cheap home theater system for pennies on the dollar. THANK YOU AMAZON for a great product

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: JacTrac
Reviews.Content: I already have a Samsung LN52A630 with an excellent picture but has some issues with the sound going out. I have to turn it off, then turn it back on to reset it. This TV has no issues. This product has an excellent HD picture and normal TV is very good also. Rather have the speakers somewhere else other than on the bottom of the TV. Glad I got it!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: David L. Ayersman "deck farmer"
Reviews.Content: I've had mine for about 3 weeks and I am still totally impressed by everything about it. I use it in a back room where a 40" TV is quite impressive. I agree that in a larger room you probably want 46" or larger. I wish it had a headphone jack, but that is my only small quibble. I would still be thrilled if I had paid quite a bit more for it. By the way, the 2 year old 46" LN46B610 model in the front room has been been just as impressive. I have had no problems whatsoever with it or I wouldn't have bought this one. No quality issues here.

Reviews.Title: exceeding my expectation...well worth the money...
Reviews.Author: A Texan
Reviews.Content: Exceeding my expectation both sound and quality.  Well worth the money.  When it comes to electronic products like a LCD-TV; in my experience, don't save a few dollars for something less and will be regreted later.

Reviews.Title: A good buy
Reviews.Author: James Hobson
Reviews.Content: Have only had this flat screen for a week but for the price, it is fantastic. Picture quality far exceeded expectations. Very easy to set up. So far, can't say a bad thing about it. Works well, very attractive and definitely recommend it to anyone looking to buy a new tv.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LNC40C630
Reviews.Author: Richard Raleigh Miller
Reviews.Content: Great picture, great price from Amazon and delivery was right on time as well. Sound is great. I have not check out the Ethernet or wireless capabilities yet, but all else is great. I have already gotten compliments on the picture and resolution, even those who have 40" Samsungs, but not this model.When I try out everything I will truly know what I got, but I don't explect any trouble since I have another 24" Samsung in my computer room and it works great as well with everything working on it.

Reviews.Title: OMG...My Family and me are in LOVE!
Reviews.Author: MrsMas4Eva "PsWife"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV on Tuesday and since then my husband, kid and me have been stuck in our bedroom watching TV. This is not our first HDTV but it sure is our best! The picture and sound quality is unbelievable. My husband connected his PS3 to it and couldn't believe the difference; we previously had it connected to our livingroom TV which is a 52" JVC-DLP. There are other features this TV had except I haven't used it yet but it looks exciting. Maybe this weekend I will get to really know my new

Reviews.Title: THIS IS A GREAT TV!
Reviews.Author: SJD
Reviews.Content: I was in the market for a bigger HD than I already had but was not wanting to spend over $1000.  I do not play games, etc. but watch lots of sports and movies basically.  I narrowed it down to the Samsung and two other brands.My final decison was made after seeing the TVs live in a store and realizing that I could get the Samsung fromAmazon and not pay tax.  Plus the shipping was FREE!  The delivery was scheduled for between 3-7pm.  He arrivedpromptly at 3:00.  He brought the TV into the house and placed it in the room where I requested.  It was easyto assemble.  The manual said it was a two person job but I did it myself (I'm a 50 year old woman). The set upwas easy and accessible, especially if you have done it before.  I was not prepared for the excellent picturequality, color saturation, and actually good quality sound without even a surround sound system.  I am so pleasedwith this TV.  I haven't read the entire manual yet so I am looking forward to other applications that I haven'teducated myself about yet.  I am also really pleased that I saved myself some money - Amazon is the way to goand I LOVE THIS TV!  I can hardly wait for football season!

Reviews.Title: HDTV as it should be.
Reviews.Author: Dana49
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews, researched several HDTV sizes and models, and eventually purchased the Samsung LN40C630 40-inch 1080 p 120hz HDTV (black).  Why?  For the price and quality you will not find a better HDTV on the market.  There's a reason that Samsung is a leading name in high definition televisions.  The color, the sound, and the clarity make it a total viewing experience.  High definition television has never looked so good.

Reviews.Title: Great experience so far!
Reviews.Author: Kingston
Reviews.Content: I'm not a high-end user by any means, but I'm thrilled with this TV and the Amazon purchase (at a great price!) Out of the box it works fine for me, and I'm not even using it on HD. But again, I'm not very demanding, don't do "home theater", etc., just wanted a decent TV for general purpose viewing to replace an ancient dying CRT TV. For my modest needs, I could have bought other brands for less money, but I believe in buying great brands with good reputations even if I don't need their best stuff, and this model seemed a great balance of features, price and quality.I was amazed that Amazon's free super saver shipping included delivery AND setup, and all within about 3 days of purchase. You can't beat that from any local big box store.So, very pleased with purchase so far - time will tell, but Samsung has a good reputation in that regard.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Bill "bmega"
Reviews.Content: I moved to this TV from a Toshiba 37" LCD that I bought about 18 months ago.  The picture on this Samsung is so crisp it almost appears 3D at times.  I'm still tweaking the settings, but I am very happy with the purchase.  The only down side I can see is that the viewing angle is fairly narrow for the best picture.  Otherwise it's great.  Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Samsung and Amazon can't be beat!!
Reviews.Author: StereoGen
Reviews.Content: I was looking to upgrade to a 40" LCD with quality picture, decent onboard sound, surround sound and internet/wifi capability and she wants easy on/off with remote volume control and with those requirements I did my research. My search ended at Amazon for the LN40C630 with the lowest price, free shipping and very good reviews. The LCD TV arrived safe and on the schedule date. Removing the Samsung LCD TV from the box and set up was a breeze. The hardest part was removing my old 38" cathode tube tv that weigh well over 80 lbs.This Samsung TV is beautiful and classy looking and was definetely wife approval with all the necessary features for her and myself.  My first week of use with this Samsung tv was fairly good with a little blurring during fast actions and without the HD signal. The following week I had upgraded to the HD signal and here is where the LCD TV performed to what its designed to do. The color, detailing and action is top notch! I used recommended setting that a amazon reviewer poster had listed with a couple of my own changes. I found that all LCD have a little blurring during fast action even at 4 ms respond time, but the more you use the tv the more the blurring smooth out. The one itch I have is only when using the Directv remote, you have to press the on button twice to get the Samsung TV to turn on and repeatly press the volume to increase the sound. After 30 days of use, I really enjoy viewing with my Samsung LCD tv that I have decided to protect with investment with a 3 year warranty from Amazon as well. My ratings are conservative and I want to thank the good guys at Amazon for another happy purchase!!

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: D. Downing "Hexamerous"
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my Samsung TV.  I like the ALLSHARE feature although when playing music files I have noticed not all file types are supported  - the MP3 files play fine.  This TV also has PIP which is great if you have a need for that or just want it.  The 24p is supported by this TV on playing blu ray discs.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV
Reviews.Author: Fuzzy Thurston
Reviews.Content: This is a truly outstanding TV.  The picture is incredibly life-like.  I have had the tv for a month now and there have been no problems with the setup or anything else.  I also have a 50" Samsung plasma, one year old now, and it too is incredible.  The LCD weighs only 33 or 37 pounds -- just so easy to move around.  I was going to buy a slightly smaller screen but the price differentials between the 40" and even a comparable 32" were pretty small.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, shipping info misleading
Reviews.Author: fhmrs
Reviews.Content: The television is great!  Although the delivery person didn't seem to know it was supposed to be white glove delivery, he did open it up, set it up on the stand and turn it on.  When ordering the tv however, Amazon misleads you to think you can get it in five days, when in fact that costs extra, and it took two weeks for it arrive.  So beware when ordering.  Overall though the television is great and the price couldn't be beat.

Reviews.Title: nice and easy
Reviews.Author: dgpena
Reviews.Content: Very nice and easy to set up and handle. No complains about this TV set. This is the best 40" HDTV you can get at this price.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN40C630 40 is Excellent
Reviews.Author: Kalyan
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome. The setup was very easy. The picture quality and sound is excellent. The delivery was done by Pilot. They were excellent. They waited till I came back to my apartment, setup the TV and made sure that it was switched on before they left. AVOID the shipment from crutchfield. I had ordered LCD last month which was delivered broken, the screen completely shattered. I returned it and got this one.

Reviews.Title: Double your pleasure, double your fun
Reviews.Author: Leon A. Purta "joemaamah"
Reviews.Content: I owned a 40" 60hz Samsung for the last few years, but decided to upgrade to 120hz when Amazon put them on special pricing this spring. I had high expectations due to my great experience with the 60hz model, but I have to say the performance of this year's model met and exceeded all my expectations. In fact I was so impressed, that I went out and bought another for my Dad for Father's day/his birthday. What does that tell ya? Believe me, you can't go wrong buying this TV at Amazon's price. The closest competitor was still $100 more than what I paid for mine, then they dropped the price another $35 when I got my dad's. If you are sitting on the fence about buying and LCD TV, now's the time to make the jump and get this now!

Reviews.Title: Great Television!
Reviews.Author: RJ's Mom
Reviews.Content: We've had this about 3 weeks now and we love it!  I decided on this model because of the recommendations of friends who also own Samsung and did all of the research.  We've been quite happy and we think the picture is outstanding!  Ordering from Amazon saved us delivery charges as well as tax.  The delivery was great...the man unpacked the box, set up the tv, and tested the picture and audio before he left!  Great experience, all in all!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Item - Samsung LN40C630 40-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: jcconde
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent TV. Picture quality and sound are terrific; i really like it.I would recommneded.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: Funkytrojan
Reviews.Content: Great bargain I love it replaced a 36 inch picture tube tv that was well over 100 lbs.  Came very quickly from amazon.

Reviews.Title: Love this Samsung!
Reviews.Author: Wiz
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with the quick and safe delivery from Amazon.com. Our Samsung 630 arrived in perfect condition.The picture quality and features are great. The sound quality is acceptable but could be improved.Overall the Samsung is a great product.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: Glenn "Glenn"
Reviews.Content: I have a 55" Samsung LED which is fantastic. This TV's picture is stunning also.I have never gone wrong with Samsung and Amazon.Delivery was quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for price
Reviews.Author: Tammy Clark
Reviews.Content: This TV has a very sharp clear picture. Shipping was very fast. Set up was very easy.  Picture is as good as the more expensive models. Overall for the price, this TV is a great value!

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV
Reviews.Author: Douglas E Ford
Reviews.Content: I just received my Samsung HD-TV this morning and it is wonderful. The set-up was really easy from attaching the stand to the on-screen menu's The picture quality is great and the sound quality is better than I expected. The price is great and if you get the free shipping as I did then it is a really great deal.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Eric Davis "Emoney"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a CRT 1080i HDTV to this TV.  I was doing the upgrade for a safety issue (Massive cords sticking out of the TV and no console could hold the TV, isn't great for little kids)... I really wasn't thinking it would be that much of a difference going from one HDTV to another.  I was very wrong.  This is a fantastic TV that made regular DVDs look like HD DVD.  The Set-up was super easy.  The only knocks are the sound and the preset brightness levels.  The sound can't seem to level out the difference components of a movie or TV show.  For example:  The voice of the actor of the movie is the same level as the background noise, making it very difficult to hear the actor.  We have the benefit of having a receiver with a 5.1 speaker set-up, so this problem doesn't bother me, but it would if I didn't have this.  Second, the dynamic picture setting tends to be too bright but he movie is too dark.  So, it depends what I'm watching as to what I place the settings on.  Overall, I love this TV and the price is excellent.  I didn't know what I was missing in a picture till I bought this.

Reviews.Title: The Best TV for the basic understanding and price.
Reviews.Author: Jared Renshaw
Reviews.Content: HI everyone,Here is a great site that explains the auto motion plus on the Samsung TV, in addition what each mode means. Here is the link:[...]I don't know what KS's Review is talking about the picture not being great out of the box, mine looked amazing. However, KS is 100% right about the auto motion plus on clear mode. If you play a lot of games like me, i have a PS3, either have the auto motion plus on Clear or off, otherwise there is a lag in the gaming or weird look that we are all not use to, unless you watch soap operas, LOL. I have to agree with KS i only have positives about this TV. However, i wish the touch buttons on the front of the TV lit up or if they were a different color besides dark gray. It is impossible to see them, but that is why you have a remote controller :P. If you are thinking about buying this TV, DO IT, i swear you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: Loved everything I've seen so far
Reviews.Author: A. Fry
Reviews.Content: This is my first HD/LCD TV so keep that in mind as you read this review.  Given my limited experience with these TV for my money the picture quality is excellent.  The sound is better than I expected.  It's as close to surround sound as you could ever hope for from a non-surround system.  The TV is a great value.

Reviews.Title: Works flawlessly
Reviews.Author: distance runner
Reviews.Content: Shipping was arranged promptly and smoothly; set-up was easy on my own (although it took me a while to figure out that I had to loosen the screws a bit in the stand to allow the screen to swivel); and programming was fine using the manual. I put this down in our playroom so the kids would be willing to have thier friends down there and give us some space.  Although I am only an occasional TV and movie watcher, it is so enjoyable now to view programming in true high definition. I highly recommend this model if the specs meet your requirements. After spending many hours over a number of months researching various possibilities for my first HDTV, I zeroed in on this Samsung model, which fit all of my criteria and had received numerous excellent reviews. After two months, I am very pleased and completely satisfied with this TV's performance.

Reviews.Title: Samsung are awesome
Reviews.Author: Donald Wengerter "Wengy"
Reviews.Content: As usual Samsung 600 series is excellent. Sound is getting better but it works for my daughter in her school apartment

Reviews.Title: samsung is a hit
Reviews.Author: Patti Pitney
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this TV to anyone who values high picture quality, very little artifacting (stuttering, shuddering, etc). The bezel attracts a lot of dust, but we have 2 cats, so we probably have more hair/dust flying around than most people. Very nice TV for the price. I use my laptop with an hdmi connection to run the TV. Everything looks great and works well. The sound quality is definitely above-par for a TV, but ofcourse can't really compare to proper sound system. Lots of options and settings to tweak in the menus, which can be a little overwhelming, but I really appreciate them. Has a network connection (wired, or optional wireless), but it is only for media sharing capabilities, this TV does not support streaming Netflix. This was a bit of a disappointment for me, because I read a review where they said it does support outside movie rentals. Oh well, aside from that, I think it is a good buy

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this TV
Reviews.Author: J. Bailey
Reviews.Content: I've had it for 2 weeks and not a problem. It looks great and has everything I wanted. The price is a little higher then I wanted to spend but it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: 2010 Samsung 40" 1080P LCD  LN40C630
Reviews.Author: marc
Reviews.Content: The TV set was delivered within the time frame I specified. Delivery person was courteous. Now getting to the TV. I read the Amazon reviews on the 2009 models for the TV's in this series and was impressed by what they wrote. I went to a local store and checked out the TV there and compared it to the other major brands. I could not see any difference between this set and more expensive ones.After unpacking the set I  attached  the smoked glass base by myself though Samsung recommends 2 people. The set swivels which is a nice touch when you might want to sit off center. I did not have to make any adjustments to the picture, it was perfect (in my eyes) right off the bat. Flesh tones were perfect. The sound is good, it's not tinny, has a fullness to it. This is a good buy for the money. So far I've been very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV for the price!!
Reviews.Author: lessthanjake032
Reviews.Content: While looking to upgrade from my 720p 60hz 42" Samsung Plasma TV, I did some research and came up with this as my final choice.  I waited a few days while it was $809 and it went on sale for $744 and free shipping.  Can't ask for more than that.  Received the television in perfect shape - box unharmed.  The guys even take out the television for you so you can make sure there is no damage.  I was a little skeptical about ordering a TV online, but there was no problem at all in the process.  Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: B. Duffy
Reviews.Content: After much research, we decided on this model and are extremely satisfied with our choice. The price was also the best around which helped clinch the deal.  The picture is so amazing it sometimes feels like the people are live in our room!  We purchased this for a Master Bedroom...and the 40 inch size was the best choice.Also, the service from Amazon was excellent from beginning to end.  I was initially concerned with how it would be delivered but it was extremely professional and accommodating.  I would highly recommend purchasing this TV and using Amazon for any big electronic expenditure.

Reviews.Title: A Great TV
Reviews.Author: B "B"
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoy this tv. This is the 3rd Samsung in the house and so far every one of them has performed exceptionally well. I gave the sound quality 4 stars because I hook it up to my own sound system, so I don't really ever use the tv's speakers. This tv is really only used to play Xbox 360 and DVD's and you feel like you are in the action. I have compared this to other tvs my friends have such as vizio and panasonic, and I would choose this tv 100 times over. Definitely a good purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good Value Great TV
Reviews.Author: Kain "Kain"
Reviews.Content: I've had my television for a few days now and while watching I decided i needed to hop on the computer and write this review. The picture is stunning with some minor tweaking although it looked pretty decent right out of the box.All the product specs were accurate and delivery by pilot was on time and professional. I wanted a nice television for the bedroom and this is perfect but if you care at all about the sound quality you should definitely get a sound system. I paired my TV with the Sony HTCT100 Sound Bar with Subwoofer - Black since i didn't need anything crazy for the bedroom I have my XBOX 360 hooked up and my tv. Nice feature of the Sony soundbar by the way is that the sub it comes with has multiple audio inputs so you don't need a receiver. I also got the Walker Edison Regal 42-inch 4-in-1 TV Stand with Mount which holds this TV perfectly if you're looking to have the TV mounted but don't want to bolt it to the wall it also has up down and left right swivel. The total setup cost me less than 1300 bucks and I couldn't be happier. Plus since i have Amazon Prime everything was shipped to me for free! This review seems like more of an advertisement but I promise if you're looking for something classy looking for the bedroom this is a sweet setup! Since I've plugged everything else i just bought I might as well mention if you're getting this in the bedroom i also picked up a couple of Brentwood Brushed Twill Bedrest, Navy for more comfortable bed watching and they are comfortable and cheap! THANK YOU AMAZON!

Reviews.Title: Samsung LCD a good choice
Reviews.Author: B. Moselle
Reviews.Content: I've had this Samsung LCD TV for about 4 weeks now, and I'm very happy with the purchase. There are a lot of settings, and different viewing situations (DVDs, live sports, regular TV programming) require a lot of settings adjustments to maximize picture quality. But fortunately, the settings are easy to change.I patiently waited and reviewed LCD TVs for about a year before finally settling on this one. For the amount I spent ($750), I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Incredible value for the price point
Reviews.Author: Mark Johnson "Johnson"
Reviews.Content: Being our second LCD 1080p television I always thought our Sharp Aquos from 3 or 4 years ago was the best television for blu-ray I've seen.  But this Samsung takes it to a whole new level in terms of performance for the price.  1080p output is outstanding and the television is housed in a beautiful black shell which is pretty thin for the size.Would recommend this to anyone looking to get into the 40 inch market under $1000.  I bought this one from Amazon for 740 bucks.  Great price, shipping was a tad slow but I was in no rush, worth the savings compared to $900 at Best Buy.  Ceva did a nice job and carried the television into the house where I wanted it too!One of the best sub $1000 1080p televisions I've seen hands down.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Buckaroo
Reviews.Content: I'd buy it again.I will buy it again, since this one went to my Daughter.Even un-tweaked it is beautiful.When I get a chance to optimize the settings, I'm sure it will be even better.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV at a super low price!
Reviews.Author: Herbert E. Taylor "World Traveler1"
Reviews.Content: We had a really nice 42 inch Vizio TV with 240hz.  However, one feature I wanted was the ability to watch netflix on the tv directly.  The latest model of that TV just came out with wifi connectivity and netflix as an widget.  However, I just could NOT get myself to pay almost $848 for that tv, which is the cheapest price that I found.  So I waited, then I waited some more, then I waited some more.  In my mind, a 40 to 42 inch 120hz tv should cost more than $600.  Well the waiting paid off.  Samsung's new LN40C630 recently came out with a price that dipped into the high $700's.  No it didn't have internet connectivity, but I found with the first tv that I could just hook the computer up to it and solve that issue. Better yet, a salesman suggested I get a blue ray player (Samsung) that had that feature.  Today after reviewing Amazon, [...], [...] and more, I went on a hunt.  Found the Samsung at an incredible 'in store' price of $619 at my local electronic shop. No prices on the web come close at all.  The store that I brought it from has a national website and on their own website the TV is $809.  That is a $180 saving which was enough to get the blue ray player!As the other reviewers have said this set is absolutely amazing and with the blue ray player I now also have the netflix access that I wanted, without my bulky computer sitting next to the TV.  Operating the tv was very intuitive, because I have a 24 inch Samsung tv with the exact same setup.  It is strong in pulling in all of the digital channels (more than 105) on my cable without that crazy set top box.  I'm very pleased.  Samsung rock!

Reviews.Title: Love Samsung
Reviews.Author: Beth T. Tippett
Reviews.Content: I love this TV.  We have had a great experience with not only the TV, but the price, shipping, delivery . . . everything.

Reviews.Title: BEST TV EVER
Reviews.Author: Mike Smyth "letsgolakeshow"
Reviews.Content: Like any consumer I researched tons of HD tvs and was set on a 40 or 46". I chose the Samsung LNC630 and it is the best purchase I have ever made. The picture is absolutely spectacular....so clean and clear with HDMI. I have an upconverting dvd player and 300 looked RIDICULOUS. The sound is great too, which I did not expect. Samsung has really made a top of the line tv and the 120 hz is the best way to go :)

Reviews.Title: so pleased with purchase
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoGal
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd Samsung HD tv we have purchased in the last couple of years.  The picture quality, especially in HD, is like being in the movies.  Set up is a breeze with plug in and go format.  Our space limited the size of the screen, but we are extremely pleased with the purchase.  My husband is hard of hearing and, although, we have tv connected to dvd player, the audio from the tv is more than adequate, even without using the amplification feature.  Amazon's price and delivery service was great.

Reviews.Title: First HD TV
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Clemente
Reviews.Content: I've been shopping around and looking for a TV for my room. This 40" HD TV works great! It's not too small and not too big. It was a huge upgrade from my 10 year old TV so everything seems to be awesome. I got this for $770 along with a PS3 with FF13. AMAZING! I can't find anything bad about this except for how long it took to ship.

Reviews.Title: Amazon=Good.  Jury is in Samsung is Good!
Reviews.Author: J.M. Boyle
Reviews.Content: I got this TV w/free delivery. It came quicker than I expected so kudos to Amazon.  I will be updating this review as things unfold because I want to be fair.  This is the first TV I've had in over 15 years so I'm no expert on TVs, but I am pretty tech savvy. Right out of the box I had a problem. The instructions said to assemble the stand first, so I did.  Then when I tried to set the TV on the stand the screw holes would not line up.  Long story short, they shipped it with the wrong part.  I called Samsung and the first service rep told me the part was on nationwide back order and wouldn't even guess how long it would take to ship.  When I get a red flag like that I usually rethink my purchase; I mean it seems clear to me that they deliberately shipped it with the wrong part.  So I thought about it awhile and called back, this time the rep said the part was not on back order and should ship in 7-10 days.  One of them has to be wrong.  I ordered the correct guide stand.  I managed to get temporary use of another mount in order to make sure the thing actually worked.  So I set it up and turned it on and installed theSamsung  WIS09ABGN LinkStick Wireless LAN Adapter (purchased separately).  After some time I got it to link to my home network, but with an error message saying there was a problem with my service provider, Bellsouth. I called BS and they wanted $29 for an "Advanced Technical Support Issue."  I declined. I haven't got a dvd player yet and I don't have cable so I don't really know if the thing works or not.  I'll be contacting Samsung for help with the Wifi.  I'll let you know how that goes.Update 12/19/2012.  No problems at all so far. This has been a long time coming but I got the stand issue taken care of at no additional cost. Kudos to Samsung. Bought a Samsung Blu-Ray DVD player and with wireless LAN adapter the DVD player found my home network easily and has not really hiccupped since.  The picture is great, especially with Blu-Ray discs or streaming HD from my Mac. (I also got an HDMI cable so I now have a 40" monitor)  Some old tv shows when streamed look grainy, but that is not the fault of the TV.  I had thought I'd buy external speakers but really I don't see the need. Sound quality is excellent and I sit a good 10 feet away and never turn the volume up over 50%.I still don't have cable, or even an antenna so I can't comment on how it works with that. But Netflix, Vudu, BBC News and You tube all work great over my wireless.

Reviews.Title: nice tv but has problems
Reviews.Author: wanted a good tv
Reviews.Content: It is a nice tv.  However, it has a few pinpoint defects in the screen where it appears there are no pixels and clear light shines through.  I would never expect that from this calibur of tv especially at the price.  To return it is going to be a complete hassle and involve time without a tv...and it will need to be set up all over again...

Reviews.Title: Nice while it lasted. But 15 months? Really?
Reviews.Author: BearguyVA
Reviews.Content: I finally caved in and bought an HDTV after my old Toshiba 32" bit the dust. The rest of my family all love their Samsung TV's, so that's what I bought. I liked the picture quality, although I find it very annoying that using the HDMI inputs disables closed captioning.After 15 months, it started acting like it was posessed. It would change channels, change the volume, try to reset the picture, on and on. I thought maybe the remote had a problem, so I took the batteries out of it and went to bed (figuring I'd go get new batteries the next day.) The TV turned itself on in the middle of the night! So I know it's not the remote that's causing the problem.My local TV repair says that the main circuit board is shot (bad capacitors, apparently a common Samsung problem) and that it will be almost $300 to repair. In a TV that's barely over a year old? Really?And I wholeheartedly agree with other reviewers who have said that Samsung's so-called "customer service" is a joke. Non-existent is more like it.A TV that requires this kind of major repair after barely a year, and Samsung's total lack of customer service, is completely unacceptable. Needless to say, I (and the rest of my family) will NOT be buying Samsung again.

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG entertainment centre
Reviews.Author: Murtuza Hashim "hashimm4"
Reviews.Content: I received my tv within four days of purchasing it from AMAZON. So far I am enjoying it very much. It has 4 HDMI inputs and 2 USB inputs. I connected my apple TV and am currently watching movies through my Netflix account on the TV. On the down side the TV does not come with a wireless LAN adapter. That is required if you want to stream directly through the TV instead of a device. I am streaming through my Apple TV so that was not required by me.  The picture quality is crisp. It has three picture modes Dynamic, Normal and Movie. The movie mode is meant to be watched in dark rooms to have less strain on your eys by dimming the backlight. The Dynamic mode is meant more for day time. My first movie I watched on it was TRON. and it was a great movie to watch on this TV as it shows all the good qualities about this TV.

Reviews.Title: Dead pixel
Reviews.Author: SSG
Reviews.Content: Tv was great for the first 4 hours then one of the pixels went out on the buttom right hand side of this tv. i was so disappointed because this was my second tv from samsung and the first one i bought was the 60Hz but i had sound issues. the sound would have audio dropage and clipping was very bad because you could not enjoy a movie without the voices dropping out.

Reviews.Title: Lots of ghosting
Reviews.Author: Robhuns
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I'd seen a store display and next to a plasma of approximately the same price, the picture actually looked a lot clearer, and the glare was much less.  I bought it for both watching sports and blu-rays.  I'll say that watching football is pretty nice.  Football is set up where normally the camera isn't panning much, or at least the player you are looking at stays in the same position on the screen, and this TV works pretty well for that.  And a freeze frame looks great.On blu-rays it's a different story.  I don't know if it's because blu-rays (and all movies) are shot at 24 frames/second so maybe the 120 HZ doesn't help, but on blu-rays, there is an awful amount of ghosting any time the camera pans.  It gets so bad that it actually occasionally makes me a little sick to my stomach.  It honestly makes me think that it might be better to watch movies on my low def CRT I used to have.  I've never had another LCD to compare it to, but if you are getting an HDTV to watch blu-rays on, you really need to get a much more expensive one that doesn't have the ghosting issues (if there is one) or go plasma maybe.  Or just save your money and stick with your CRT.

Reviews.Title: 3rd and final C630 worked
Reviews.Author: Alan I.
Reviews.Content: I studied online for two weeks before making my purchase.  I picked the C630 as my first flat screen TV because it was a middle of the line model with features I wanted.  My first TV arrived DOA with no video, but audio.  A call to Samsung for repair meant downtime for two weeks as parts shipped from NJ to CA.  After my frustration, I contacted Amazon for a return.  My second TV arrived overnight, but also DOA with no video, but audio.  After another round of phone calls to Samsung, I made the decision to ship back to Amazon and not wait another two weeks for repair.  Amazon accepted both DOA TV's with no questions asked, paid for shipping, and credited my payment card as expected.  I ended up buying my 3rd C630 from my local Best Buy for the same sale price (not the same take home price) and the TV has worked from moment one.  I would recommend a working Samsung C630 to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied with Samsung LN40C630 40-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Youhcup
Reviews.Content: I am satisfied with my purchase of the Samsung LN40C630 40-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LCD HDTV.  This is an upgrade of the Samsung LCD 32-Inch TV that I had.  Good picture quality, DLNA connection, and a 3mm external jack at the back.  I can connect my earphone with a breeze but your phones must have its own volume control as it couldn't be controlled by using the external jack.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, Internet Function is Useless Though
Reviews.Author: Adam M
Reviews.Content: I don't know why this TV has internet capability.  You can only use it for home network stuff, which you could easily do anyways with a normal TV and a laptop.  I didn't pay enough attention to the specs, and just remembered seeing another reviewer say he uses it for Netflix streaming.  But I'm guessing that is because he uses the TV as a monitor, and the Netflix streaming is simply through his computer (dude, you should mention that instead of giving people the wrong impression.)That said, it's a good TV.  Picture is great.  Just looked at a few DVDs of mine on my Oppo upscaler, they look really good.  The motion enhancement/blur reduction is nice too, although it can make movies look kind of like soap operas.  I had to turn it off while watching LOTR, but it made Finding Nemo quite nice.  Probably better for animated stuff, and live TV.For the price, it's an excellent TV.  I just wish they made it clear that this TV will never be used for anything on the web, rather than blur the issue by mentioning the fact that you can wirelessly connect to it, who cares?

Reviews.Title: Beware the Samsung Flicker!
Reviews.Author: a reader in Calif
Reviews.Content: You can benefit from my experience. Before purchasing, google "Samsung flicker" or "Samsung capacitors" (in each case, without the quotes). There is a lot of information on the Internet indicating that Samsung's off-shore manufacturers have used faulty capacitors in their unit power supply--apparently this problem affects both Samsung TV's and monitors. When this happens, you will not notice anything wrong at first, as it takes the capacitors time to fail (google "capacitor plague") but when they start failing you will experience flickering and dimness at first and can expect this to get worse over time and for the unit to finally completely fail.If you are lucky, you will have problems while the unit is still under warranty. However, the replacement unit you receive may have the same problems, and when it fails will almost certainly be out of warranty.My experience: Samsung replaced my unit on warranty, but the replacement unit they sent me failed (with the issues described) shortly afterwards and was "out of warranty." While I didn't expect much I did call Samsung customer service to see if they had any program to address this. They do not. Once the warranty is over, you're on your own. At the price they quoted it really isn't worth fixing it, so it looks like I'm stuck with a very expensive paperweight. May you make better decisions and have better luck in your purchase!

Reviews.Title: short life tv
Reviews.Author: James Alumkal
Reviews.Content: life of the tv is : 2 yrs and 10 months[power board problem]to repair you need to pay $350.Never buy !!

Reviews.Title: HDMI ports died one by one
Reviews.Author: J. Knight
Reviews.Content: Switched cables and different devices. Last working HDMI connection needs to be jiggled to work. If you google Samsung HDMI there are others complaining as well.

Reviews.Title: don't get 120hz, get the 60hz
Reviews.Author: Mr. A
Reviews.Content: unless all you watch is sports, don't get the 120hz.  save yourself the money and get the 60hz version.  otherwise you'll be watching everything like a mexican soap opera.yes, you can just turn the "smoothness" off, but then you're just running at 60hz anyhow.this is not a dig on samsung, i got the 60hz version and it's absolutely great. this is an example of how upgrades just aren't always better.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for the price
Reviews.Author: mustang65
Reviews.Content: Arrived with free shipping in 2 days. Easy set up out of the box. Picture and sound quality is outstanding. I upgraded from a 34" CRT HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Good tv just misses the mark
Reviews.Author: D. Kelly
Reviews.Content: First I should say I am a Samsung fan I have owned a 32" series 5 since they were first introduced. In comparison this set has more contrast, color control and runs at 120hz verses the 60hz of my series 5. These along with a much better back lit remote and a sleek glass front and other features like pip give this set a clear advantage over the series 5.Now to the trouble I have had. I have been viewing over the air broadcasts and when the signal is weak the tv freezes. The screen goes blank and all functions freeze. I can't change channels or switch to blue ray or pc. I have to manually shut off the tv and reboot it like a virus ridden pc. I have emailed Samsung about this issue and have yet to get a response. Frankly I am very suprised I have never had a day of trouble with my old set.The only other issue I have had is with the color. There are a lot of options for tweaking the color and it took me almost a week to find the right mix for the color orange. I watch a lot of football so I know when the color of any jerzy is off and found it a very frustating and slow process to get it right. My series five was much simpler and had better color right out of the box.If i did not use this set for pc and PS3 I would have opted for a plasma for about the same price I could have gotten a 50" set, but I have friends that own plasmas and there are still burn in issues with even the latest models. Don't beleive the manufacturers or the sales reps.Overall a good set if I could get the freezing problem fixed I would give this set a four star rating.Pros:Good contast and 120hz makes football much smoother than 60hzNice intuitive backlit remoteSmart design that allow control of my Denon receiver through the tv so I can hide my receiverPip so I can keep an eye on the halftime show as I type this reviewBetter over the air tuner than my series 5 I pull in several more channelsCons:The aforementioned freezing issuePoor color out of the box with involved tweaking neededSome pixelation noticable in dark shadowsBottom line this is a good set for the six hundred I paid for it but if I didn't have the pc and PS3 hooked up I may have been better of with a comperably priced plasma that runs at 600hz.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV For The Living Room
Reviews.Author: Kivanc Muslu
Reviews.Content: If you live in an apartment like me (a one with a small living room), then this TV will be looking great in your living room. Its design is very good and the delivery was perfect. I had a scheduled delivery from Pilot and they even bring the TV inside the house and tested it!PROs:- Many HDMI Outputs (it has 3)- 2 USB outputs- Ability to Play media from USB- Excellent Sound and Video- Elegant Design- 3.5mm headphone Output (I didn't think this was so important)CONs:- 120 Hz: Though I don't believe you can have 240 Hz even close to this price range, however it would be better.- Inability to record the playing into q USB disc or USB flash disc.- Inability to control the volume of the external speaker (e.g., headphones). This way you are left to a fix amount of volume if your headphone does not have a volume controller on it.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous for home
Reviews.Author: D. Mccauley "Techie"
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hdtv to own. Such HD quality I had not seen before. A worthy investment for home.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: It's Me
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. It has great picture quality for the price. You'll love it!

Reviews.Title: outstanding
Reviews.Author: Cris
Reviews.Content: got it from amazon tax free, with free shipping for 709. great deal. looked all over for the same tv and all the other sites were more expensive. works fine, looks clear and has nice features.

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: mjackwilson
Reviews.Content: I haven't used this TV much yet, but the  picture is stunning.  I have seen a Sharp with 120hz refresh rate that stalled and jumped.  There is no picture degradation with this TV.  It was a bit smaller than I thought.  My parents have a two year old 530 Samsung, and its picture quality is largely why I went with a Samsung as well.  When I compared them side by side, the 40in I had was a good two inches smaller in diagnol screen size.  Regardless, this does not subtract from the picture quality OR the improved sound quality over previous Samsung models in my opinion.  Perhpas more so than 1080p or HDMI input, 120hz refresh rate is an amazing difference.  Anyone buying a TV would be wise to keep this in mind.  That said, I'm very pleased with the purchase and feel that I got a bargain for $709.  For HDMI cables, I would check out [....], as they have unbeatable bargains on cables.

Since not all our channels are available in HD, we're not getting the full effect the TV is capable of producing.  Videos are great.  Like how the controls light up at night.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: R. Mone
Reviews.Content: The price was the best I could find anywhere around.  Great picture,, very happy all around.

Reviews.Title: C. Thomas
Reviews.Author: C. Thomas
Reviews.Content: This TV has great picture quality and a great price.  You get a lot for your money.  It was delivered earlier than we expected and we are extremely happy with it.

Reviews.Title: schicker
Reviews.Author: Larry Schick
Reviews.Content: I bought this set from Amazon after doing a fair amount of research.  It was highly rated by CNET.com, a leading consumer magazine and the Amazon reviews.  I also viewed it in a store.  The only poor reviews on Amazon dealt with reliability issues. When it arrived I also found that it produced an awesome picture either on a blue ray or DVD via HDMI connector.  It even seemed like the picture had a 3-D quality to it.  Unfortunately I have to watch it on a standard connection (NTSC).  In this situation the blacks seemed to run together with no definition.  You would see a man in a suit and not be able to pick out any detail in the suit.  I tried various adjustments and could not significantly improve this.  I then put in next to a old 40 inch Sony V series with the same inputs.  Their were even greens that were being projected as black.  On the Sony, the black details were clearly visible.  In Summary:  With HDMI or component digital input, awesome picture.  It you have to view it via a HTSC cable input, the blacks may drive you to distraction due to their lack of definition.  I finally returned it to Amazon.  Amazon was great about this!

Reviews.Title: A word of warning for this Samsung 40" TV
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Hammond "christoc"
Reviews.Content: A month ago I moved, and because of that decided that it was time to get a new TV for the bedroom, rather than moving the old CRT across the country. So I picked up a Samsung 40" LCD TV that did 1080p and 120mhz, the model was LN40C630K1F and it was purchased from Best Buy. All seemed well at first, the TV performed great, until I noticed something, a blue pixel on the screen, when it shouldn't be blue. So after about a week (of the bad pixel) the TV went back to Best Buy to get exchanged for another of the same model.I brought this new TV home and hooked it up, everything was great for a few minutes then the TV was attacked by some red vertical lines, which eventually turned to black.I checked connections, restarted everything, with no change. Eventually the lines went away, but they came back a few times throughout the week.Today I took the TV back to Best Buy and picked up a 40" Sony LCD. Thanks to Best Buy for the great customer service! They were extremely helpful throughout the whole process. I went ahead and purchased their 4yr protection plan for the new TV, just in case anything goes wrong with this one.

Reviews.Title: motion problems + beware of free shipping option from amazon
Reviews.Author: Joybomb "Joybomb"
Reviews.Content: Amazon definately had the lowest price around for this tv, I have to give them that.The things I am happy about:the size of the tv is great. The color is also great. Watching anything that is mastered for HD looks great, generally. Sometimes there are motion issues, even in HD mastered material (newer tv shows and movies)(more on this below). Video games look great on it. Reduces the eye strain I was feeling with our smaller set.The things I am unhappy about:I was not home when my television was delivered - a week early with no notifation - and I found it in the hallway of my apartment building. AMAZON SENT IT UPS WITH NO SIGNATURE REQUIRED. The tv was ok, but I was astonished.Perhaps I am a sensitive viewer, but I see alot of motion issues - blur and jitters, when either the color is too intense or the motion is too fast. I must be a very sensitive viewer, since my boyfriend doesnt see this as often as I do, but I have seen people complain in online forums. Also, if you are watching an older tv show or movie (even on dvd, not bluray), 60% of the time it looks like total crap. For instance I caught "The Notebook" on cable the first night we had the tv, and it looked like a cheap student film. Think what you want about the actual movie, but I remember that it was beautifully shot. I have played with alot of the settings and have managed to make the tv look ok most of the time.So I guess this is what you get for a $700 120hz 1080p 40 inch tv. I thought I was smart for buying Samsung!

Reviews.Title: Samsung LCD
Reviews.Author: Dooman
Reviews.Content: I purchased this set a few months ago for a much lower price (under $670). At that price I consider it a great deal. It was delivered by CEVA somewhat on-time (they did get the day correct) and it has performed flawlessly since setup. I have encountered none of the problems of other reviewers. After having used the set for some time now and comparing it to my Panasonic plasma which I have owned for 2.5 years, I can definitely comment on the differences. This Samsung looks good, HD over the air especially looks very good. But the image can be somewhat harsh and artificial when compared to the plasma. I have also noticed image stutter on it although I don't consider it a huge issue. I can say after comparison that I prefer the plasma. Apparently I got my Panny just before the rising black level issue took hold, because my set still looks as good as it did on day 1, excellent.I would encourage anyone to look into the possibility of receiving HD over the air using an antenna. I purchased an indoor antenna from Monoprice when I bought the plasma but found after experimenting that on old telescoping antenna from an old TV worked just as well. If you are near the towers you can get very good stable reception and best of all it's FREE!!! Plus the signal is not subjected to another layer of processing and compression from your cable provider, it is coming directly from the station to the tower to you. Go to [...] and follow the instructions for determining your ability to receive HD OTA.Also I mentioned Monoprice. Flat-out the BEST place to buy AV cables, adapters etc... I even purchased a internet router from them, very cheap, works like a champ.
