Reviews.Title: Disappointed by the Lack of a Headphone Jack.
Reviews.Author: Miguel C. Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: I own this item and before I bought it I also had a larger 46-inch Samsung (model number LN46A750) that I am very happy with.  Oddly enough you cannot find this 46-inch version using Amazon's search, but thanks to Google, it was able to find it for me on Amazon's site, so here's the link:http://www.amazon.com/Samsung-LN46A750-46-Inch-1080p-Touch/dp/B0014175OI  The 46-inch version has a "Headphone Jack".  I love that I can hook up my Logitech 2.1 speakers to it.  By "hook up" I mean when the speakers are plugged into the headphone jack, the crappy internal speaker that faces away in the back cuts off and I can control the volume of my external speakers using the TV remote.  This 40-inch version (a newer model BTW) has a 3.5mm jack in the pastel green color we come to expect; but when I plug it in, the muffled internal speaker stays on and the external speakers stay at a constant volume despite me using the TV's volume remote!  I searched on-line and found this response from Samsung_HD_Tech on a CNet forum:  "I'm sorry to hear that you're having trouble controlling the volume.The 3.5mm jack is a fixed audio out input, rather than a headphone jack, and isn't controlled by the volume controls on the TV. So the external speakers will require an amp for the volume control."  I'm sure for many of you here this means nothing to you because you're either pumping your audio through a proper Home Theater System (HTS) using a second remote or have cranked up the volume to 100 in an effort to discern the muffled dialogue coming out of this TV's internal speakers with everyone around you thinking your hearing aid is on the fritz again.  So, if you're like me and enjoy hooking up a cheap 2.1 sound system to your TV, then definitely pass on this one.  REMEMBER, it is not enough that the TV has a green 3.5mm Audio Out jack - it MUST say "Headphone Jack" in the specs and have a little round-shaped icon in the shape of headphones next to it on the TV.  As for the rest of the review of this TV, I can't get past the awful (and I do mean truly awful) sound to enjoy watching any programming on it.  It sits in the garage as a TV for those who lost out in musical chairs.  When we set it up, I noticed it was crooked (welded/glued/fused together) wrong, but it's not noticeable from regular viewing distances.  It tilts down and to the left, like it's turned a few degrees off.  I hear the picture is amazing from the rest of my family (but what else do you expect from a PS3 pumping 1080p to a 40-inch screen).  It is truly a waste of money for the way I want to use it.  I can't even give it away.  If I gave it to my grandma then I'd imagine poor granny trying to watch her tv novelas with the volume all the way up wondering why she can't make out what they're saying.  And I'm not spending 100-200$ on an HTS and teaching my family to juggle another remote.  This is the 3rd Samsung I've bought on Amazon, and everyone who visits the house loves them (they think I'm rich!).  I'll still stick with good ole' Sammy, but it was a costly lesson to learn.

Reviews.Title: Very frustrated.
Reviews.Author: Scottiepoppins
Reviews.Content: Going off of my experience with this tv I have no choice but to rate it low. I ordered the tv just before the new year, it got to me quicker than I would have ever expected. Unfortunately that's where my good news ended. I kind of blame both amazon and samsung for the issues that followed: I opened my tv like it was gold, making sure every thing was done correctly (not to destroy the contents). Placed the tv on the stand, put the batteries in the remote, and poured a cold drink. When I hit the power button nothing happened, okay lets try the power on the tv... Still nothing. Not to be out witted by my tv I try a different power cable, with no resolve. Okay, lets make the call to support and see what there suggestions a are; "Thank you for picking samsung, how may I help you". So long story short they tell me what I already know and tell me to contact amazon, but they will be more than happy to set up a service to come take a look. After searching the internet find a actual phone number for amazon (which was not easy), they stated that because the no longer have the tv in the warehouse that the can give me a refund and I can buy it from a distributer for more money... Ummm, no! Back on the phone trying to contact samsung only to find out that call centers can be effected by snow. It takes three days to get a hold of them, and the repair people can't come for another week. Okay, the repair guy is here, I get to watch tv right? Nope. So what happened is they didn't have the correct part, and that part if going to take a week and a half to come in, so I wait.... I think they forgot about me, its been a week a no update if they found the right part. "Thank you for picking samsung, how may I help you"Me: "they haven't called, they didn't leave a number, oh and the took a part for reference"Them: "that's messed up, let me call them"Me:"thanks"Them:"they should have it, to install next week"Me: "okay"What I didn't mention was I'm moving this weekend, lucky its just out of my parents house (yay for me!) so I didn't have to set anything else up, who knows how long treasury that would take. Today, after a month of waiting, its fixed with a new bezel. I have no idea how well it works because its at my parents place.Samsung: pick better contractors, your better than that. Better QC!Amazon: talk to your suppliers, tell them your customers want better quality controls.Contractors: that was just lame.

Reviews.Title: Returning it to Amazon
Reviews.Author: P. M. Gross
Reviews.Content: We always do a thorough review of big ticket items before purchase, so returning an expensive item is very unusual for us.This set has some good features.  We especially like the sound settings to send the music that frequently drowns out the dialogue to the background where it belongs.  We also like the remote control which is easier to use than most.BUT:We do not have a cable box.  The TV input comes from a direct condo-wide hookup.  It is digital but not HD.Most of the channels are cable channels; a few are local or "air" channels.  Some TV's allow the channels to be scrolled seamlessly.  This one divides the channels into two groups and several buttons need to be pressed to move from one to the oher.However, the main problem for us is picture qualtiy.  Not sharp; not clear; not vivid.  Slightly blurry or runny. Average or worse.  We have tried multiple settings including fine tuning on a channel by channel basis but the video is still unsatisfactory.Perhaps this set works best with an HD input but that is not an option for us at this time.We do note that the picture is significantly better when playing material from an attached computer which reinforces the idea that there is some sort of tuner issue or incompatibility.In any event and unfortunately, it is on its way back to Amazon and we are doing more and deeper research before replacing it.

Reviews.Title: WARNING, AVOID SAMSUNG AT ALL COSTS
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Samsung LN40C630 model after searching the web for months.  Amazon had the best price so I pulled the trigger. I received the TV very quickly and unpacked the box and started assembling the stand.  After assembling the stand I began to attach the bracket from the stand to the back of the TV. Unfortunately it did not fit and after looking at it closer it was obviously for a different tv. I began looking at the other items in the box a bit closer. It was then I noticed the owner manual, and remote were also for a different TV(5 series, 46 inch tv I later found out). The stand as it turns out was for yet another model. Frustrated I called Amazon and they advised me to contact Samsung which I did. SAMSUNG customer reps were useless and told me that all of the parts in the box (excluding the tv) were incorrectly packaged.... I asked them how could this happen, they of course never heard of this happening ever. Anyways they told me they would send new parts. 2 weeks later, after waiting patiently, the parts arrived and they were for the wrong TV.At this point I was furious so I called AMAZON and after explaining the situation they told me a replacement TV would be sent right away. A few days later I got a 2nd TV, opened the box and lo and behold the same thing, all different parts. I called AMAZON and told them I wanted a refund,(which they promptly did) and they sent someone to picked up the old TV's.Moral of the story save your money, time and energy and don't buy SAMSUNG products. Obviously they have serious quality control issues, customer service problems and other issues. Just google SAMSUNG problems/customer service and you will see I am not alone. Pray that you never have a problem with SAMSUNG products and have to call their customer service number.Best part of the transaction was getting my money back. Hope to buy a Sony or Panasonic soon..

Reviews.Title: Samsung Quality
Reviews.Author: Frank J. DeFelice
Reviews.Content: Samsung makes terrific products. This LCD TV was very easy to set up. I didn't want to hang it on the wall, so I bought a TV table (see my other reviews). This unit comes with its own stand which is easy to fasten to the back of the TV, and voila! it's good to go. The remote is easy to use, and allows you to select picture size, different zoom levels, various sources, etc. The adaptive contrast ratio is fine, so I can watch movies during the day or evening. It accepts VHS tape inputs as well as digital inputs from a DVD player etc. I ran the sound through my stereo so you need to turn off the TV sound to do that. What I like most is its slim outline, its easy portability. Reliability has been excellent. The resolution is great!

Reviews.Title: Lucky purchased an extended warranty
Reviews.Author: L. mollring "svelte9"
Reviews.Content: Purchased a LN40A530 1080p 120 in August '08.  Started having problems after original warranty expired.  Lucky I had an extended warranty.  Early 2010 only when manually turning on, sometimes black screen with a magenta colored line at top of screen would appear and stay on until I turned it off.  Then would turn back on, no problem.  As time passed it happened more frequently. It has been in and out of service since April up until now four times.  It has been in the shop since July 23rd.  The extended warranty tv service has replaced at least five parts, tv still has problem.  The tv works fine with the remote control.  Great color and sound.  Easy hook-up.  I am considering getting the Sony Bravia becuase the reviews are better, debating on another extended warranty.  Good luck on your choice!

It seemed to be only on one station though so I'm not sure on what to do yet,but it was there and didn't fade away. I checked today and the picture was fine. I hope things work out fine. Reviews.Content: They pissed me off right off the bat when their initial email said the item was on backorder and it was listed as in stock when I placed the order. Turns out their email was screwed up.An absolutely beautiful set. Setup is for idiots, took about 10 mins to attach the base, plug it in and get a picture. The picture is flawless. Waiting on a wireless mouse to hook up my computer to it.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy Samsung LCD TV's
Reviews.Author: M. Kim
Reviews.Content: google: samsung lcd tv pink dotsI purchased a brand new Samsung LCD TV in Jan 08 and the first year was great with no problems.  After about a year, I started encountering problems with it when I power it on.  I'll get these pink dots all over my screen, requiring me to turn it off, and then turn it back on numerous times.  It usually takes a good 5 minutes for normal picture quality.I've contacted customer service and they offered me NO help saying that it was out of warranty and they were not aware of this problem.  Considering how many people have filed complaints on here, the BBB, and other consumer groups, they should be more helpful with this common problem.Don't get me wrong, the picture quality is great and it would be a great tv if it worked.I'll never buy a Samsung TV again.

Reviews.Title: Beware - Samsung uses cheap capacitors for power up that fail
Reviews.Author: Mark Evans "mark e"
Reviews.Content: Many people are facing a black screen and TV repair bills as soon as 3 months after purchase due to poorly engineered power on circuits.  These are basically the same failures from 70's to current TVs that use super-cheap capacitors to boot up and commonly fail.  Worst problem is the Samsung customer service who will supposedly have it replaced "for free" (the 10 cent part) but only by their one authorized vendor at a substantial $$$ service charge.  Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52 inch LCD TV wont turn on
Reviews.Author: jerred
Reviews.Content: I have a samsung 52 inch LCD tv that i have had for a little over a year and now it will not turn on, you will hear the power up noise and then it will click off and do it over and over and over again all day long, apparently many other samsung owners have had the same problem and samsung is doing nothing about it..

Reviews.Title: Amazon: SHIP IT, I HAVE ALREADY PAID THE AMOUNT.
Reviews.Author: L. Khurmi "LK"
Reviews.Content: This TV is great and I have seen it at many places now. My issue is with AMAZON not shipping it after a week since I paid. Don't advertise FREE SHIPPING when it takes almost 2 weeks before you get your product. Not happy at all.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, but Samsung LCD failed after 15 uses, poor service
Reviews.Author: drift "drift"
Reviews.Content: After minimal use hanging on a wall for 22 months, the Samsung 40 inch LCH 1080p has severe red tinge and is unusable.  Buyer beware;$1150 down the drain. Buy Sony.

Reviews.Title: DOA
Reviews.Author: J. Clifton
Reviews.Content: At long last, the tv arrived, only to be refused and immediately sent back out the door. It was DOA.  I'll give it one more chance and see if the replacement is any better.  I'm pretty happy I bought the extended warranty at this point.

Reviews.Title: What about skin tone quality on these Samsungs?
Reviews.Author: Pearl King "purlie1"
Reviews.Content: I've been reading a lot about reviewers' raves/issues with the various Samsung models, but have yet to see a comment on skin tone quality or how to adjust settings for it.  It's the one area I am not happy with (I have the 26" C350).  What do you think?

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware - this TV will not turn on after a few years
Reviews.Author: Phuong nguyen
Reviews.Content: I bought a Samsung 40 inch LCD TV from Amazon in 03/2007, it was great until a month ago when it suddenly won't turn on at all. It make clicking noise and turn the TV on about 10 minutes but now it is completedly dead.I called Samsung but was told this model was not on the recall list so I have to pay for the repair.Search on Google and you will see this is not a rare occurrence. Stay away from Samsung product.
